Text2: And among us there are righteous folk and among us there are far from that. We are sects having different rules.

Text1: Think not of those, who are slain in the way of Allah, as dead. Nay, they are living. With their Lord they have provision.
Text2: And announce unto the believers the good tidings that they will have great bounty from Allah.

Text1: My brother Aaron is more eloquent in speech than I: so send him with me as a helper to confirm my truthfulness for I fear that they will reject me as a liar."
Text2: and appoint for me, from my household, someone who will help me bear my burden -

Text1: and they carry your loads to many a place which you would be unable to reach without much hardship. Surely your Lord is Intensely Loving, Most Merciful.
Text2: and are carried on them and also on ships.

Text1: The likeness of those who spend their wealth in Allah_s way is as the likeness of a grain which groweth seven ears, in every ear a hundred grains. Allah giveth increase manifold to whom He will. Allah is All-Embracing, All-Knowing.
Text2: And argue not with the People of the Scripture unless it be in (a way) that is better, save with such of them as do wrong; and say: We believe in that which hath been revealed unto us and revealed unto you; our Allah and your Allah is One, and unto Him we surrender.

Text1: Those who, while they sat at home, said of their brethren (who were fighting for the cause of Allah): If they had been guided by us they would not have been slain. Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Then avert death from yourselves if ye are truthful.
Text2: And as a summoner unto Allah by His permission, and as a lamp that giveth light.

Text1: So they twain set out till, when they were in the ship, he made a hole therein. (Moses) said: Hast thou made a hole therein to drown the folk thereof? Thou verily hast done a dreadful thing.
Text2: And as for A_ad, they were destroyed by a fierce roaring wind,

Text1: Ask them (O Muhammad) of the township that was by the sea, how they did break the Sabbath, how their big fish came unto them visibly upon their Sabbath day and on a day when they did not keep Sabbath came they not unto them. Thus did We try them for that they were evil-livers.
Text2: And as for Thamud, We gave them guidance, but they preferred blindness to the guidance, so the bolt of the doom of humiliation overtook them because of what they used to earn.

Text1: and surely yours shall be a never-ending reward,
Text2: And as for those who are blessed, they shall abide in the Garden as long as the heavens and the earth endure, unless your Lord may will otherwise. They shall enjoy an unceasing gift.

Text1: and wherein they will live for ever: what an excellent abode and what an excellent resting place!
Text2: And as for those who are blessed, they shall abide in the Garden as long as the heavens and the earth endure, unless your Lord may will otherwise. They shall enjoy an unceasing gift.

Text1: except for those who believe and do good deeds. Theirs shall be an unending reward.
Text2: And as for those who are blessed, they shall abide in the Garden as long as the heavens and the earth endure, unless your Lord may will otherwise. They shall enjoy an unceasing gift.

Text1: This is Our provision for you, never to end.
Text2: And as for those who are blessed, they shall abide in the Garden as long as the heavens and the earth endure, unless your Lord may will otherwise. They shall enjoy an unceasing gift.

Text1: Verily He knoweth them and numbereth them with (right) numbering.
Text2: And as for those who are unjust, they are firewood for hell.

Text1: They question thee (O Muhammad) concerning menstruation. Say: It is an illness, so let women alone at such times and go not in unto them till they are cleansed. And when they have purified themselves, then go in unto them as Allah hath enjoined upon you. Truly Allah loveth those who turn unto Him, and loveth those who have a care for cleanness.
Text2: And as for those who believe and do good works, We shall remit from them their evil deeds and shall repay them the best that they did.

Text1: And make not Allah, by your oaths, a hindrance to your being righteous and observing your duty unto Him and making peace among mankind. Allah is Hearer, Knower.
Text2: And as for those who believe and do good works, We verily shall make them enter in among the righteous.

Text1: Lo! those who are with thy Lord are not too proud to do Him service, but they praise Him and prostrate before Him.
Text2: And as for those who choose protecting friends beside Him, Allah is Warden over them, and thou art in no wise a guardian over them.

Text1: He it is Who maketh you to go on the land and the sea till, when ye are in the ships and they sail with them with a fair breeze and they are glad therein, a storm-wind reacheth them and the wave cometh unto them from every side and they deem that they are overwhelmed therein; (then) they cry unto Allah, making their faith pure for Him only: If Thou deliver us from this, we truly will be of the thankful.
Text2: And as for those who disbelieved (it will be said unto them): Were not Our revelations recited unto you? But ye were scornful and became a guilty folk.

Text1: Ignominy shall be their portion wheresoever they are found save (where they grasp) a rope from Allah and a rope from men. They have incurred anger from their Lord, and wretchedness is laid upon them. That is because they used to disbelieve the revelations of Allah, and slew the prophets wrongfully. That is because they were rebellious and used to transgress.
Text2: And as for those who do evil, their retreat is the Fire. Whenever they desire to issue forth from thence, they are brought back thither. Unto them it is said: Taste the torment of the Fire which ye used to deny.

Text1: And unto each We have appointed heirs of that which parents and near kindred leave; and as for those with whom your right hands have made a covenant, give them their due. Lo! Allah is ever Witness over all things.
Text2: And as for those who strive against Our revelations, challenging, they will be brought to the doom.

Text1: and We raised the Mount high above them and took from them a covenant (to obey the commandment), and ordered them: 'Enter the gate in the state of prostration.' And We said to them: 'Do not violate the law of the Sabbath', and took from them a firm covenant.
Text2: And ask the people of Moses concerning the town situated along the sea how its people profaned the Sabbath when fish came to them breaking the water's surface on Sabbath days, and would not come to them on other than Sabbath-days. Thus did We try them because of their disobedience.

Text1: And when they persisted in pursuing that which had been forbidden We said: 'Become despised apes.'
Text2: And ask the people of Moses concerning the town situated along the sea how its people profaned the Sabbath when fish came to them breaking the water's surface on Sabbath days, and would not come to them on other than Sabbath-days. Thus did We try them because of their disobedience.

Text1: And you know well the story of those among you who broke Sabbath. We said to them, "Be apes despised and hated by all.
Text2: And ask the people of Moses concerning the town situated along the sea how its people profaned the Sabbath when fish came to them breaking the water's surface on Sabbath days, and would not come to them on other than Sabbath-days. Thus did We try them because of their disobedience.

Text1: It is not for the idolaters to tend Allah_s sanctuaries, bearing witness against themselves of disbelief. As for such, their works are vain and in the Fire they will abide.
Text2: And ask those of Our messengers whom We sent before thee: Did We ever appoint gods to be worshipped beside the Beneficent?

Text1: Give not unto the foolish (what is in) your (keeping of their) wealth, which Allah hath given you to maintain; but feed and clothe them from it, and speak kindly unto them.
Text2: And assuredly We gave David grace from Us, (saying): O ye hills and birds, echo his psalms of praise! And We made the iron supple unto him,

Text1: Say (O Muhammad): What thing is of most weight in testimony? Say: Allah is Witness between me and you. And this Quran hath been inspired in me, that I may warn therewith you and whomsoever it may reach. Do ye in sooth bear witness that there are gods beside Allah? Say: I bear no such witness. Say: He is only One Allah. Lo! I am innocent of that which ye associate (with Him).
Text2: And at night-time; have ye then no sense?

Text1: We have enjoined upon man kindness to his parents, but if they exert pressure on you to associate with Me in My Divinity any that you do not know (to be My associate), do not obey them. To Me is your return, and I shall let you know all that you have done.
Text2: and be humble and tender to them and say: "Lord, show mercy to them as they nurtured me when I was small."

Text1: Do not even cast your eyes towards the worldly goods We have granted to different kinds of people, nor grieve over the state they are in, but turn your loving attention to the believers instead,
Text2: and be meek to the believers who follow you.

Text1: There has come to you a Messenger of Allah from among yourselves, who is distressed by the losses you sustain, who is ardently desirous of your welfare and is tender and merciful to those that believe.
Text2: and be meek to the believers who follow you.

Text1: If ye punish, then punish with the like of that wherewith ye were afflicted. But if ye endure patiently, verily it is better for the patient.
Text2: And be not ye as those who forgot Allah, therefor He caused them to forget their souls. Such are the evil-doers.

Text1: (It will be said): Were not My revelations recited unto you, and then ye used to deny them?
Text2: And be thrown to scorching fire.

Text1: O ye who believe! Be not as those who disbelieved and said of their brethren who went abroad in the land or were fighting in the field: If they had been (here) with us they would not have died or been killed: that Allah may make it anguish in their hearts. Allah giveth life and causeth death; and Allah is Seer of what ye do.
Text2: And bear in mind that which is recited in your houses of the revelations of Allah and wisdom. Lo! Allah is Subtile, Aware.

Text1: He said: Cast it down, O Moses!
Text2: And bear with patience what they utter, and part from them with a fair leave-taking.

Text1: (O Muhammad), if they do not believe in this Message, you will perhaps torment yourself to death with grief, sorrowing over them.
Text2: And bear with patience, (O Muhammad) - and your patience is only because of the help of Allah - and do not grieve over them, nor feel distressed by their evil plans.

Text1: And they have a crime against me, so I fear that they will kill me.
Text2: And believeth in goodness;

Text1: And lo! for all such, hell will be the promised place.
Text2: And beside them are two other gardens,

Text1: Had they but found a refuge, or caverns, or a place to enter, they surely had resorted thither swift as runaways.
Text2: And blessed be He unto Whom belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, and with Whom is knowledge of the Hour, and unto Whom ye will be returned.

Text1: Say: Verily those who invent a lie concerning Allah will not succeed.
Text2: And bring them in unto the Garden which He hath made known to them.

Text1: And in the absence of Moses his people made the image of a calf from their ornaments, which lowed. Did they not observe that it could neither speak nor give them any guidance? And still they made it an object of worship. They were indeed wrong-doing.
Text2: and brought out of there (from the molten gold) the effigy of a calf that lowed." The people cried out: "This is your deity and the deity of Moses, whom Moses has forgotten."

Text1: He answered: "I saw what the people did not see. So I took a handful of dust from the trail of the Messenger, and I flung it (into the fire). Thus did my mind prompt me."
Text2: and brought out of there (from the molten gold) the effigy of a calf that lowed." The people cried out: "This is your deity and the deity of Moses, whom Moses has forgotten."

Text1: and by the day as it displays the sun's glory,
Text2: and by the day when it breaks in its glory,

Text1: It is He Who causes the dawn to split forth, and has ordained the night for repose, and the sun and the moon for reckoning time. All this is determined by Allah the Almighty, the All-Knowing.
Text2: and by the day when it breaks in its glory,

Text1: Abiding there so long as the heavens and the earth endure save for that which thy Lord willeth. Lo! thy Lord is Doer of what He will.
Text2: And by the Lord of the heavens and the earth, it is the truth, even as (it is true) that ye speak.

Text1: Lo! I have rewarded them this day forasmuch as they were steadfast in that they, even they, are the triumphant.
Text2: And by the moon when she is at the full,

Text1: But ye chose them for a laughing-stock until they caused you to forget remembrance of Me, while ye laughed at them.
Text2: And by the night and all that it enshroudeth,

Text1: And it is Allah Who has ordained the night as a garment for you, and the sleep as a repose of death, and the day as the time of return to life.
Text2: and by the night as it envelopes the sun;

Text1: and made the night a covering,
Text2: and by the night as it envelopes the sun;

Text1: and by the night when it departs.
Text2: and by the night as it recedes,

Text1: and by the night as it recedes,
Text2: and by the night when it covers the world with peace:

Text1: (Pharaoh) said: Produce it then, if thou art of the truthful!
Text2: And by the night when it is stillest,

Text1: and We made the sky a secure canopy; and yet they turn away from these Signs.
Text2: and by the sky and by Him Who made it;

Text1: when the seas shall be set boiling,
Text2: and by the swelling sea:

Text1: The adulterer shall not marry save an adulteress or an idolatress, and the adulteress none shall marry save an adulterer or an idolater. All that is forbidden unto believers.
Text2: And by the witness and that whereunto he beareth testimony,

Text1: Lo! we ardently hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we are the first of the believers.
Text2: And by this land made safe;

Text1: Then through water We caused gardens of date-palms and vines to grow for you wherein you have an abundance of delicious fruits and from them you derive your livelihood.
Text2: and by virtue of which He causes crops and olives and date-palms and grapes and all kinds of fruit to grow for you. Surely in this there is a great Sign for those who reflect.

Text1: Surely Allah does not forgive that a partner be ascribed to Him, although He forgives any other sins for whomever He wills. He who associates anyone with Allah in His divinity has indeed forged a mighty lie and committed an awesome sin.
Text2: And call to mind when Luqman said to his son while exhorting him: _My son, do not associate others with Allah in His Divinity. Surely, associating others with Allah in His Divinity is a mighty wrong.ù

Text1: Those who believe and did not tarnish their faith with wrong-doing for them there is security, and it is they who have been guided to the right way.'
Text2: And call to mind when Luqman said to his son while exhorting him: _My son, do not associate others with Allah in His Divinity. Surely, associating others with Allah in His Divinity is a mighty wrong.ù

Text1: Recall the time when We delivered you from the slavery of Pharaoh's people. They had inflicted a dreadful torment on you: they killed your sons and let your daughters live. And in this there was a hard trial for you from your your Lord.
Text2: And call to mind when Moses said to his people: "Remember Allah's favour upon you when He delivered you from Pharaoh's people who afflicted you with a grievous chastisement, slaughtering your sons, while letting your women live. In it there was a terrible trial from your Lord."

Text1: Allah has sealed up their hearts and ears and a covering has fallen over their eyes, and they have incurred the severest punishment.
Text2: And call to mind when Moses said to his people: _O my people, why do you torment me when you know well that I am Allah's Messenger to you?ù So when they deviated, Allah made their hearts deviant. Allah does not direct the evil-doers to the Right Way.

Text1: And whenever a surah is revealed, they glance at each other as though saying: "Is anyone watching?" Then they slip away. Allah has turned away their hearts for they are a people who are bereft of understanding.
Text2: And call to mind when Moses said to his people: _O my people, why do you torment me when you know well that I am Allah's Messenger to you?ù So when they deviated, Allah made their hearts deviant. Allah does not direct the evil-doers to the Right Way.

Text1: Say, (O Prophet), it was revealed to me that a band of jinn attentively listened to (the recitation of the Quran) and then (went back to their people) and said:
Text2: And call to mind when We sent to you a party of the jinn that they may listen to the Quran. When they reached the place (where you were reciting the Quran), they said to one another: _Be silent (and listen).ù And when the recitation ended, they went back to their people as warners.

Text1: He has prescribed for you the religion which He enjoined upon Noah and which We revealed to you (O Muhammad), and which We enjoined upon Abraham and Moses and Jesus, commanding: _Establish this religion and do not split up regarding it.ù What you are calling to is very hard upon those who associate others with Allah in His Divinity. Allah chooses for Himself whomsoever He pleases and guides to Himself whoever penitently turns to Him.
Text2: And call to mind, (O Prophet), when We took the covenant from all Prophets; and also from you and Noah and Abraham, Moses, and Jesus the son of Mary. We took from them a solemn covenant

Text1: and the earth will throw up all her burdens,
Text2: and casts out what is within it and is emptied,

Text1: And when Our revelations are recited unto them, thou knowest the denial in the faces of those who disbelieve; they all but attack those who recite Our revelations unto them. Say: Shall I proclaim unto you worse than that? The Fire! Allah hath promised it for those who disbelieve. A hapless journey_s end!
Text2: And cause the grain to grow therein

Text1: Is He Who is aware of the deserts of every soul (as he who is aware of nothing)? Yet they ascribe unto Allah partners. Say: Name them. Is it that ye would inform Him of something which He knoweth not in the earth? Or is it but a way of speaking? Nay but their contrivance is made seeming fair for those who disbelieve and they are kept from the right road. He whom Allah sendeth astray, for him there is no guide.
Text2: And caused the earth to gush forth springs, so that the waters met for a predestined purpose.

Text1: Pharaoh pursued them with his hosts, but they were fully overwhelmed by the sea.
Text2: and caused them to be covered with that which He covered them with.

Text1: Indeed the worst kind of all beasts in the sight of Allah are the people that are deaf and dumb, and do not understand.
Text2: And certainly We have created for Hell many of the jinn and mankind; they have hearts with which they fail to understand; and they have eyes with which they fail to see; and they have ears with which they fail to hear. They are like cattle - indeed, even more astray. Such are utterly heedless.

Text1: and by Him Who created the male and the female:
Text2: and created you in pairs (as men and women),

Text1: Direct us on to the Straight Way,
Text2: And did We not show him the two highroads (of good and evil)?

Text1: Surely We showed him the Right Path, regardless of whether he chooses to be thankful or unthankful (to his Lord).
Text2: And did We not show him the two highroads (of good and evil)?

Text1: Keep yourself content with those who call upon their Lord, morning and evening, seeking His pleasure, and do not let your eyes pass beyond them. Do you seek the pomp and glitter of the world? Do not follow him whose heart We have caused to be heedless of Our remembrance, and who follows his desires, and whose attitude is of excess.
Text2: And do not drive away those who invoke their Lord in the morning and the evening, seeking His pleasure all the time. You are by no means accountable for them just as they are by no means accountable for you. If you still drive them away, you will become among the wrong-doers.

Text1: My people! I seek no recompense from you. My recompense is only with Allah. Nor will I drive away those who believe. They are destined to meet their Lord. But I find you to be an ignorant people.
Text2: And do not drive away those who invoke their Lord in the morning and the evening, seeking His pleasure all the time. You are by no means accountable for them just as they are by no means accountable for you. If you still drive them away, you will become among the wrong-doers.

Text1: All that is on earth will perish,
Text2: and do not invoke any god beside Allah. There is no god but He. All will perish but He. To Him belongs the command. And to Him shall all of you return.

Text1: and urges not the feeding of the needy.
Text2: and do not urge one another to feed the poor,

Text1: (O Prophet), tell those of My servants who believe that they should establish Prayer and spend out of what We have provided them with, both secretly and openly, before there arrives the Day when there will be no bargaining, nor any mutual befriending.
Text2: And dread the Day when no one shall avail anyone in any way; nor shall any ransom be accepted from anyone; nor shall intercession profit any body; nor shall the offenders be helped from any quarter.

Text1: Truly those who disbelieved and died as unbelievers, not even an earth full of gold will be accepted from them as ransom. For such people there is painful chastisement; and none shall come to their help.
Text2: And dread the Day when no one shall avail anyone in any way; nor shall any ransom be accepted from anyone; nor shall intercession profit any body; nor shall the offenders be helped from any quarter.

Text1: Work not confusion in the earth after the fair ordering (thereof). and call on Him in fear and hope. Lo! the mercy of Allah is nigh unto the good.
Text2: And each soul is paid in full for what it did. And He is Best Aware of what they do.

Text1: And the Garden will be brought nigh for those who ward off (evil).
Text2: And Earth yieldeth up her burdens,

Text1: He said: Aye, and ye will then surely be of those brought near (to me).
Text2: And eased thee of the burden

Text1: Even thus is the grasp of thy Lord when He graspeth the townships while they are doing wrong. Lo! His grasp is painful, very strong.
Text2: And ere the dawning of each day would seek forgiveness,

Text1: O Prophet! Say unto those captives who are in your hands: If Allah knoweth any good in your hearts He will give you better than that which hath been taken from you, and will forgive you. Lo! Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
Text2: And even so We sent not a warner before thee (Muhammad) into any township but its luxurious ones said: Lo! we found our fathers following a religion, and we are following their footprints.

Text1: Tell My bondmen who believe to establish worship and spend of that which We have given them, secretly and publicly, before a day cometh wherein there will be neither traffick nor befriending.
Text2: And every small and great thing is recorded.

Text1: And a curse was made to follow them in the world and on the Day of Resurrection. Lo! A_ad disbelieved in their Lord. A far removal for A_ad, the folk of Hud!
Text2: And every soul cometh, along with it a driver and a witness.

Text1: And they set up rivals to Allah that they may mislead (men) from His way. Say: Enjoy life (while ye may) for lo! your journey_s end will be the Fire.
Text2: And every thing they did is in the scriptures,

Text1: Those who believe, and have left their homes and striven with their wealth and their lives in Allah_s way are of much greater worth in Allah_s sight. These are they who are triumphant.
Text2: And every token that We showed them was greater than its sister (token), and We grasped them with the torment, that haply they might turn again.

Text1: Then they threw down their cords and their staves and said: By Pharaoh_s might, lo! we verily are the winners.
Text2: And exalted thy fame?

Text1: And they say: If only he would bring us a miracle from his Lord! Hath there not come unto them the proof of what is in the former scriptures?
Text2: And feed with food the needy wretch, the orphan and the prisoner, for love of Him,

Text1: And He has placed firm mountains on the earth lest it should move away from you, and has made rivers and tracks that you may find your way,
Text2: and firmly fixed in it mountains;

Text1: And the dwellers in Al-Hijr denied (Our) messengers.
Text2: And flesh of fowls that they desire.

Text1: When thou didst say unto the believers: Is it not sufficient for you that your Lord should support you with three thousand angels sent down (to your help)?
Text2: And follow that which is inspired in thee from thy Lord. Lo! Allah is Aware of what ye do.

Text1: Theirs will be a bed of hell, and over them coverings (of hell). Thus do We requite wrong-doers.
Text2: And follow the better (guidance) of that which is revealed unto you from your Lord, before the doom cometh on you suddenly when ye know not,

Text1: And thrust thy hand within thine armpit, it will come forth white without hurt. (That will be) another token.
Text2: And food which choketh (the partaker), and a painful doom

Text1: And for every nation there is a messenger. And when their messenger cometh (on the Day of Judgment) it will be judged between them fairly, and they will not be wronged.
Text2: And for all there will be ranks from what they do, that He may pay them for their deeds; and they will not be wronged.

Text1: And if We had not made thee wholly firm thou mightest almost have inclined unto them a little.
Text2: And for such of your women as despair of menstruation, if ye doubt, their period (of waiting) shall be three months, along with those who have it not. And for those with child, their period shall be till they bring forth their burden. And whosoever keepeth his duty to Allah, He maketh his course easy for him.

Text1: If He will, He can remove you, O people, and produce others (in your stead). Allah is Able to do that.
Text2: And for the moon We have appointed mansions till she return like an old shrivelled palm-leaf.

Text1: And if anyone of the idolaters seeketh thy protection (O Muhammad), then protect him so that he may hear the Word of Allah, and afterward convey him to his place of safety. That is because they are a folk who know not.
Text2: And for their houses doors (of silver) and couches of silver whereon to recline,

Text1: And indeed they supposed, even as ye suppose, that Allah would not raise anyone (from the dead) -
Text2: And for those who disbelieve in their Lord there is the doom of hell, a hapless journey_s end!

Text1: Say (unto them): If ye possessed the treasures of the mercy of my Lord, ye would surely hold them back for fear of spending, for man was ever grudging.
Text2: And for those who disbelieve in their Lord there is the doom of hell, a hapless journey_s end!

Text1: The believers, both men and women, are allies of one another. They enjoin good, forbid evil, establish Prayer, pay Zakah, and obey Allah and His Messenger. Surely Allah will show mercy to them. Allah is All-Mighty, All-Wise.
Text2: And from among you there must be a party who invite people to all that is good and enjoin the doing of all that is right and forbid the doing of all that is wrong. It is they who will attain true success.

Text1: Why were there not, out of the generations that passed away before you, righteous men who would forbid others from causing corruption on the earth? And if such were there, they were only a few whom We had saved from those generations, or else the wrong-doers kept pursuing the ease and comfort which had been conferred upon them, thus losing themselves in sinfulness.
Text2: And from among you there must be a party who invite people to all that is good and enjoin the doing of all that is right and forbid the doing of all that is wrong. It is they who will attain true success.

Text1: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me.
Text2: And from the evil of malignant witchcraft,

Text1: And I ask of you no wage for it; my wage is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.
Text2: And from the evil of the envier when he envieth.

Text1: Those who break the Quran into parts.
Text2: And fruit in plenty

Text1: So we took vengeance on them; and lo! they both are on a high-road plain to see.
Text2: And fruit that they prefer

Text1: He knoweth all that is before them and all that is behind them, and unto Allah all things are returned. $$A
Text2: And fruits and grasses:

Text1: He said: But this, their chief hath done it. So question them, if they can speak.
Text2: And fruits such as they desire.

Text1: Allah chooseth from the angels messengers, and (also) from mankind. Lo! Allah is Hearer, Seer.
Text2: And garden-closes of thick foliage

Text1: And (mention) Dhu_n-Nun, when he went off in anger and deemed that We had no power over him, but he cried out in the darkness, saying: There is no Allah save Thee. Be Thou Glorified! Lo! I have been a wrong-doer.
Text2: And gardens of thick foliage.

Text1: Thou askest them no fee for it. It is naught else than a reminder unto the peoples.
Text2: And gave a little, then was grudging?

Text1: Their home will be the Fire because of what they used to earn.
Text2: And gave them plain commandments. And they differed not until after the knowledge came unto them, through rivalry among themselves. Lo! thy Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that wherein they used to differ.

Text1: and abundant fruit,
Text2: And give good news (O Muhammad), to those who believe in this Book and do good deeds (in accordance with its teachings). For them there will be gardens underneath which canals flow. Their fruits will so resemble the fruits on the Earth that every time they will be provided with fruits, they will say, "Such fruits were provided to us before on the Earth. " And there will be pure spouses for them and therein they will live for ever.

Text1: Allah verily hath shown grace to the believers by sending unto them a messenger of their own who reciteth unto them His revelations, and causeth them to grow, and teacheth them the Scripture and wisdom; although before (he came to them) they were in flagrant error.
Text2: And glorify Him early and late.

Text1: Or (why is not) treasure thrown down unto him, or why hath he not a paradise from whence to eat? And the evil-doers say: Ye are but following a man bewitched.
Text2: And goblets set at hand

Text1: O mankind! A similitude is coined, so pay ye heed to it: Lo! those on whom ye call beside Allah will never create a fly though they combine together for the purpose. And if the fly took something from them, they could not rescue it from it. So weak are (both) the seeker and the sought!
Text2: And grapes and green fodder

Text1: O ye who believe, say not (unto the Prophet): "Listen to us" but say "Look upon us," and be ye listeners. For disbelievers is a painful doom.
Text2: And grieve thou not for them, nor be in distress because of what they plot (against thee).

Text1: And when it is said unto them: Prostrate to the Beneficent! they say: And what is the Beneficent? Are we to prostrate to whatever thou (Muhammad) biddest us? And it increaseth aversion in them.
Text2: And guide him to the parting of the mountain ways?

Text1: And certainly We have created for Hell many of the jinn and mankind; they have hearts with which they fail to understand; and they have eyes with which they fail to see; and they have ears with which they fail to hear. They are like cattle - indeed, even more astray. Such are utterly heedless.
Text2: And had Allah known in them any good He would surely, have made them hear; but (being as they, are) even if He made them hear, they would have surely turned away in aversion.

Text1: And of them there are some who appear to pay heed to you, but upon their hearts We have laid coverings so they understand it not; and in their ears, heaviness (so they hear not). Even if they were to witness every sign, they would still not believe in it so much so that when they come to you, they dispute with you, those who disbelieve contend: 'This is nothing but fables of the ancient times.'
Text2: And had Allah known in them any good He would surely, have made them hear; but (being as they, are) even if He made them hear, they would have surely turned away in aversion.

Text1: See how they lie against themselves, and (how) the thing which they devised hath failed them!
Text2: And had he not been one of those who glorify (Allah)

Text1: And when ye call to prayer they take it for a jest and sport. That is because they are a folk who understand not.
Text2: And had it not been for the favour of my Lord, I too had been of those haled forth (to doom).

Text1: Fain would they put out the light of Allah with their mouths, but Allah disdaineth (aught) save that He shall perfect His light, however much the disbelievers are averse.
Text2: And had We willed We could have set among you angels to be viceroys in the earth.

Text1: And of their taking usury when they were forbidden it, and of their devouring people_s wealth by false pretences, We have prepared for those of them who disbelieve a painful doom.
Text2: And had We willed, We verily could have fixed them in their place, making them powerless to go forward or turn back.

Text1: Because of the wrongdoing of the Jews We forbade them good things which were (before) made lawful unto them, and because of their much hindering from Allah_s way,
Text2: And had We willed, We verily could have quenched their eyesight so that they should struggle for the way. Then how could they have seen?

Text1: while We had brought the jinn into being before out of blazing fire.
Text2: and has created the jinn from the flame of fire.

Text1: Serve Allah and ascribe no partner to Him. Do good to your parents, to near of kin, to orphans, and to the needy, and to the neighbour who is of kin and to the neighbour who is a stranger, and to the companion by your side, and to the wayfarer, and to those whom your right hands possess. Allah does not love the arrogant and the boastful,
Text2: and has made me dutiful to my mother. He has not made me oppressive, nor bereft of God's blessings.

Text1: Highly blessed is He, Who has made fortified spheres in the heavens and has set in it a "lamp" and a shining moon.
Text2: and has placed the moon in them as a light, and the sun as a radiant lamp?

Text1: As for the Foremost, they will be the foremost!
Text2: And hasten to the for-giveness of your Lord and to a Paradise as vast as the heavens and the earth, prepared for the God-fearing.

Text1: So vie with one another in seeking to attain your Lord's forgiveness and a Garden whose width is as the width of the heaven and the earth, one which has been prepared for those who believe in Allah and His Messengers. That is Allah's bounty which He bestows upon those whom He pleases. Allah is the Lord of abounding bounty.
Text2: And hasten to the for-giveness of your Lord and to a Paradise as vast as the heavens and the earth, prepared for the God-fearing.

Text1: Never cometh there unto them a new reminder from their Lord but they listen to it while they play,
Text2: And hath awarded them for all that they endured, a Garden and silk attire;

Text1: And say: My Lord! I seek refuge in Thee from suggestions of the evil ones,
Text2: And hath cast out all that was in her, and is empty

Text1: And that those who have been given knowledge may know that it is the truth from thy Lord, so that they may believe therein and their hearts may submit humbly unto Him. Lo! Allah verily is guiding those who believe unto a right path.
Text2: And hath fear,

Text1: Unto Him is the return of all of you; it is a promise of Allah in truth. Lo! He produceth creation, then reproduceth it, that He may reward those who believe and do good works with equity; while, as for those who disbelieve, theirs will be a boiling drink and painful doom because they disbelieved.
Text2: And hath made of service unto you whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth; it is all from Him. Lo! herein verily are portents for a people who reflect.

Text1: Doth not man remember that We created him before, when he was naught?
Text2: And hath made the moon a light therein, and made the sun a lamp?

Text1: And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob; each of them We guided; and Noah did We guide aforetime; and of his seed (We guided) David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron. Thus do We reward the good.
Text2: And hath the story of the litigants come unto thee? How they climbed the wall into the royal chamber;

Text1: Then We heard his prayer and removed that adversity from which he suffered, and We gave him his household (that he had lost) and the like thereof along with them, a mercy from Our store, and a remembrance for the worshippers;
Text2: And have appointed a dazzling lamp,

Text1: And of the evil ones (subdued We unto him) some who dived (for pearls) for him and did other work, and We were warders unto them.
Text2: And have appointed the day for livelihood.

Text1: And unto Solomon (We subdued) the wind in its raging. It set by his command toward the land which We had blessed. And of everything We are Aware.
Text2: And have appointed the night as a cloak,

Text1: And We taught him the art of making garments (of mail) to protect you in your daring. Are ye then thankful?
Text2: And have appointed your sleep for repose,

Text1: O ye who believe! Believe in Allah and His messenger and the Scripture which He hath revealed unto His messenger, and the Scripture which He revealed aforetime. Whoso disbelieveth in Allah and His angels and His scriptures and His messengers and the Last Day, he verily hath wandered far astray.
Text2: And have created for them of the like thereof whereon they ride.

Text1: We have adorned the lower heaven with lamps, and have made them a means to drive away the satans. We have prepared for them the chastisement of the Blazing Fire.
Text2: and have protected it from every rebellious satan.

Text1: And (mention) Ishmael, and Idris, and Dhu_l-Kifl. All were of the steadfast.
Text2: And have sent down from the rainy clouds abundant water,

Text1: But Allah (Himself) testifieth concerning that which He hath revealeth unto thee; in His knowledge hath He revealed it; and the angels also testify. And Allah is sufficient Witness.
Text2: And have subdued them unto them, so that some of them they have for riding, some for food?

Text1: (On the day) when those who were followed disown those who followed (them), and they behold the doom, and all their aims collapse with them.
Text2: And he and his hosts were haughty in the land without right, and deemed that they would never be brought back to Us.

Text1: So Allah gave them the reward of the world and the good reward of the Hereafter. Allah loveth those whose deeds are good.
Text2: And He brought those of the People of the Scripture who supported them down from their strongholds, and cast panic into their hearts. Some ye slew, and ye made captive some.

Text1: O ye who believe! if ye obey those who disbelieve, they will make you turn back on your heels, and ye turn back as losers.
Text2: And He caused you to inherit their land and their houses and their wealth, and land ye have not trodden. Allah is ever Able to do all things.

Text1: If Allah bring thee back (from the campaign) unto a party of them and they ask of thee leave to go out (to fight), then say unto them: Ye shall never more go out with me nor fight with me against a foe. Ye were content with sitting still the first time. So sit still, with the useless.
Text2: And he cried unto his Lord, (saying): These are guilty folk.

Text1: The foolish of the people will say: What hath turned them from the qiblah which they formerly observed? Say: Unto Allah belong the East and the West. He guideth whom He will unto a straight path.
Text2: And he entered the city at a time of carelessness of its folk, and he found therein two men fighting, one of his own caste, and the other of his enemies; and he who was of his caste asked him for help against him who was of his enemies. So Moses struck him with his fist and killed him. He said: This is of the devil_s doing. Lo! he is an enemy, a mere misleader.

Text1: Allah will not take you to task for that which is unintentional in your oaths, but He will take you to task for the oaths which ye swear in earnest. The expiation thereof is the feeding of ten of the needy with the average of that wherewith ye feed your own folk, or the clothing of them, or the liberation of a slave, and for him who findeth not (the wherewithal to do so) then a three days_ fast. This is the expiation of your oaths when ye have sworn; and keep your oaths. Thus Allah expoundeth unto you His revelations in order that ye may give thanks.
Text2: And he glanced a glance at the stars

Text1: And as for the two of you who are guilty thereof, punish them both. And if they repent and improve, then let them be. Lo! Allah is ever relenting, Merciful.
Text2: And he had no warrant whatsoever against them, save that We would know him who believeth in the Hereafter from him who is in doubt thereof; and thy Lord (O Muhammad) taketh note of all things.

Text1: As for the Disbelievers, Whether thou warn them or thou warn them not it is all one for them; they believe not.
Text2: And he had read it unto them, they would not have believed in it.

Text1: The Messiah will never scorn to be a slave unto Allah, nor will the favoured angels. Whoso scorneth His service and is proud, all such will He assemble unto Him;
Text2: And he hath coined for Us a similitude, and hath forgotten the fact of his creation, saying: Who will revive these bones when they have rotted away?

Text1: And, likewise, the beings supposed to have a share in Allah's divinity have made the slaying of their offspring seem lawful to many of those who associate others with Allah in His divinity so that they may ruin them and confound them regarding their faith. If Allah had so willed, they would not have done that. Leave them alone to persist in their fabrication.
Text2: and he hides himself from people because of the bad news, thinking: should he keep the child despite disgrace, or should he bury it in dust? How evil is their estimate of Allah!

Text1: And verily We shall make you to dwell in the land after them. This is for him who feareth My Majesty and feareth My threats.
Text2: And he indeed had warned them of Our blow, but they did doubt the warnings.

Text1: The pilgrimage is (in) the well-known months, and whoever is minded to perform the pilgrimage therein (let him remember that) there is (to be) no lewdness nor abuse nor angry conversation on the pilgrimage. And whatsoever good ye do Allah knoweth it. So make provision for yourselves (Hereafter); for the best provision is to ward off evil. Therefore keep your duty unto Me, O men of understanding.
Text2: And He is Allah; there is no Allah save Him. His is all praise in the former and the latter (state), and His is the command, and unto Him ye will be brought back.

Text1: It may be that thou tormentest thyself (O Muhammad) because they believe not.
Text2: And he is indeed a failure who stunteth it.

Text1: And the chieftains of his folk, who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter, and whom We had made soft in the life of the world, said: This is only a mortal like you, who eateth of that whereof ye eat and drinketh of that ye drink.
Text2: And he is not avid of the Unseen.

Text1: 'Then if they give you the lie, say: 'Your Lord is of unbounded mercy; but His punishment shall not be averted from the guilty folk.'
Text2: and He is the Ever Forgiving, the Most Loving

Text1: Had it not been for the grace of Allah and His mercy unto you in the world and the Hereafter an awful doom had overtaken you for that whereof ye murmured.
Text2: And He is the Forgiving, the Loving,

Text1: (O Qureysh!) If ye sought a judgment, now hath the judgment come unto you. And if ye cease (from persecuting the believers) it will be better for you, but if ye return (to the attack) We also shall return. And your host will avail you naught, however numerous it be, and (know) that Allah is with the believers (in His Guidance).
Text2: And He it is Who accepteth repentance from His bondmen, and pardoneth the evil deeds, and knoweth what ye do,

Text1: Those are they for whom is naught in the Hereafter save the Fire. (All) that they contrive here is vain and (all) that they are wont to do is fruitless.
Text2: And He it is Who hath withheld men_s hands from you, and hath withheld your hands from them, in the valley of Mecca, after He had made you victors over them. Allah is Seer of what ye do.

Text1: And they swear by Allah that they are in truth of you, when they are not of you, but they are folk who are afraid.
Text2: And He it is Who in the heaven is Allah, and in the earth Allah. He is the Wise, the Knower.

Text1: He it is Who is God in the heavens and the earth. He is the Most Wise, the All-Knowing.
Text2: And He it is Who is One True God in the heavens and in the earth. He knows your deeds - both secret and open - and knows fully whatever you earn.

Text1: Lo! the worst of beasts in Allah_s sight are the deaf, the dumb, who have no sense.
Text2: And He it is Who sendeth down the saving rain after they have despaired, and spreadeth out His mercy. He is the Protecting Friend, the Praiseworthy.

Text1: Thus we have revealed it as a Lecture in Arabic, and have displayed therein certain threats, that peradventure they may keep from evil or that it may cause them to take heed.
Text2: And he knoweth that it is the parting;

Text1: That they may witness things that are of benefit to them, and mention the name of Allah on appointed days over the beast of cattle that He hath bestowed upon them. Then eat thereof and feed therewith the poor unfortunate.
Text2: And He made dark the night thereof, and He brought forth the morn thereof.

Text1: Turning unto Allah (only), not ascribing partners unto Him; for whoso ascribeth partners unto Allah, it is as if he had fallen from the sky and the birds had snatched him or the wind had blown him to a far-off place.
Text2: And He made fast the hills,

Text1: And those who afterwards believed and left their homes and strove along with you, they are of you; and those who are akin are nearer one to another in the ordinance of Allah. Lo! Allah is Knower of all things.
Text2: And he made it a word enduring among his seed, that haply they might return.

Text1: So, When they despaired of (moving) him, they conferred together apart. The eldest of them said: Know ye not how your father took an undertaking from you in Allah_s name and how ye failed in the case of Joseph aforetime? Therefore I shall not go forth from the land until my father giveth leave or Allah judgeth for me. He is the Best of Judges.
Text2: And He revealed unto His slave that which He revealed.

Text1: Say: The evil and the good are not alike even though the plenty of the evil attract thee. So be mindful of your duty to Allah, O men of understanding, that ye may succeed.
Text2: And he said: Lo! I am going unto my Lord Who will guide me.

Text1: Lo! Allah (it is) Who splitteth the grain of corn and the date-stone (for sprouting). He bringeth forth the living from the dead, and is the bringer-forth of the dead from the living. Such is Allah. How then are ye perverted?
Text2: And he said: Lo! I have preferred the good things (of the world) to the remembrance of my Lord; till they were taken out of sight behind the curtain.

Text1: And We have sent thee (O Muhammad) only as a bearer of good tidings and a warner.
Text2: And he saith: I have destroyed vast wealth:

Text1: The alms are only for the poor and the needy, and those who collect them, and those whose hearts are to be reconciled, and to free the captives and the debtors, and for the cause of Allah, and (for) the wayfarer; a duty imposed by Allah. Allah is Knower, Wise.
Text2: And he saith: O my Lord! Lo! these are a folk who believe not.

Text1: And lo! unto each thy Lord will verily repay his works in full. Lo! He is Informed of what they do.
Text2: And he set it before them, saying: Will ye not eat?

Text1: These twain (the believers and the disbelievers) are two opponents who contend concerning their Lord. But as for those who disbelieve, garments of fire will be cut out for them; boiling fluid will be poured down on their heads,
Text2: And he showed him the tremendous token.

Text1: And when We did appoint for Moses thirty nights (of solitude), and added to them ten, and he completed the whole time appointed by his Lord of forty nights; and Moses said unto his brother, Aaron: Take my place among the people. Do right, and follow not the way of mischief-makers.
Text2: And He showeth you His tokens. Which, then, of the tokens of Allah do ye deny?

Text1: And when Moses said unto his people: O my people! Ye have wronged yourselves by your choosing of the calf (for worship) so turn in penitence to your Creator, and kill (the guilty) yourselves. That will be best for you with your Creator and He will relent toward you. Lo! He is the Relenting, the Merciful.
Text2: And he sought among the birds and said: How is it that I see not the hoopoe, or is he among the absent?

Text1: But Satan seduced him, saying: "Adam! Shall I direct you to a tree of eternal life and an abiding kingdom?"
Text2: And he swore to them both: 'Surely I am your sincere adviser.'

Text1: Thus Satan brought about their fall by deceit. And when they tasted of the tree, their shame became vislible to them, and both began to cover themselves with leaves from the Garden. Then their Lord called out to them: 'Did I not forbid you from that tree, and did I not warn you that Satan 'is your declared enemy?'
Text2: And he swore to them both: 'Surely I am your sincere adviser.'

Text1: Are they then secure from Allah_s scheme? None deemeth himself secure from Allah_s scheme save folk that perish.
Text2: And he who believed said: O my people! Follow me. I will show you the way of right conduct.

Text1: So the earthquake seized them and morning found them prostrate in their dwelling-place.
Text2: And he who believed said: O my people! Lo! I fear for you a fate like that of the factions (of old);

Text1: And (bethink you of) the day when We raise in every nation a witness against them of their own folk, and We bring thee (Muhammad) as a witness against these. And We reveal the Scripture unto thee as an exposition of all things, and a guidance and a mercy and good tidings for those who have surrendered (to Allah).
Text2: And he who findeth not (the wherewithal), let him fast for two successive months before they touch one another; and for him who is unable to do so (the penance is) the feeding of sixty needy ones. This, that ye may put trust in Allah and His messenger. Such are the limits (imposed by Allah); and for disbelievers is a painful doom.

Text1: In Allah's sight only those who truly believe in Allah and His Messengers are utterly truthful and true bearers of witness (for the sake of Allah). For them is their reward and their light. As for those who gave the lie to Our Signs, they are the people of Hell.
Text2: And he who obeys Allah and the Messenger -they shall be with those whom Allah has favoured -the Prophets, those steadfast in truthfulness, the martyrs, and the righteous." How excellent will they be for companions!

Text1: The way of those whom You have favoured, who did not incur Your wrath, who are not astray.
Text2: And he who obeys Allah and the Messenger -they shall be with those whom Allah has favoured -the Prophets, those steadfast in truthfulness, the martyrs, and the righteous." How excellent will they be for companions!

Text1: Ask them (O Muharnmad!): "Shall we invoke, apart from Allah, something that can neither benefit nor harm us, and thus be turned back on our heels after Allah has guided us? Like the one whom the evil ones have lured into bewilderment in the earth, even though he has friends who call him to true guidance saying: "Come to us." Say: "Surely Allah's guidance is the only true guidance, and we have been commanded to submit ourselves to the Lord of the entire universe,
Text2: And he whom Allah guides to the Right Way, none can lead him astray. Is not Allah the Most Mighty, the Lord of Retribution?

Text1: They said: Our Lord! We have wronged ourselves. If thou forgive us not and have not mercy on us, surely we are of the lost!
Text2: And he whom Allah guideth, for him there can be no misleader. Is not Allah Mighty, Able to Requite (the wrong)?

Text1: How (can there be any treaty for the others) when, if they have the upper hand of you, they regard not pact nor honour in respect of you? They satisfy you with their mouths the while their hearts refuse. And most of them are wrongdoers.
Text2: And he whose sight is dim to the remembrance of the Beneficent, We assign unto him a devil who becometh his comrade;

Text1: and by the sky and by Him Who made it;
Text2: And heaven _ We made it with Our Own Power and We have the Power to do so.

Text1: and We made the sky a secure canopy; and yet they turn away from these Signs.
Text2: And heaven _ We made it with Our Own Power and We have the Power to do so.

Text1: And with those who say: "Lo! we are Christians," We made a covenant, but they forgot a part of that whereof they were admonished. Therefor We have stirred up enmity and hatred among them till the Day of Resurrection, when Allah will inform them of their handiwork.
Text2: And heed not when they are reminded,

Text1: Hast thou seen him who chooseth for his god his own lust? Wouldst thou then be guardian over him?
Text2: And hell is brought near that day; on that day man will remember, but how will the remembrance (then avail him)?

Text1: Whose hearts fear when Allah is mentioned, and the patient of whatever may befall them, and those who establish worship and who spend of that We have bestowed on them.
Text2: And hell will stand forth visible to him who seeth,

Text1: I spake unto them only that which Thou commandedst me, (saying): Worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord. I was a witness of them while I dwelt among them, and when Thou tookest me Thou wast the Watcher over them. Thou art Witness over all things.
Text2: And helped them so that they became the victors.

Text1: The folk of Pharaoh. Will they not ward off (evil)?
Text2: And Him Who hath created male and female,

Text1: and no bosom friend will enquire about any of his bosom friends
Text2: and his consort and his children;

Text1: She said: How can I have a son when no mortal hath touched me, neither have I been unchaste?
Text2: And his kin that harboured him

Text1: Who are humble in their prayers,
Text2: And his mother and his father

Text1: and no bosom friend will enquire about any of his bosom friends
Text2: and his mother and his father;

Text1: He said: I am only a messenger of thy Lord, that I may bestow on thee a faultless son.
Text2: And his spouse and his brother

Text1: Let him who does not believe in it and follows his lust not turn your thought away from it, lest you are ruined.
Text2: and his wealth shall be of no avail to him when he perishes.

Text1: And who shun vain conversation,
Text2: And his wife and his children,

Text1: So We saved him and his household, every one,
Text2: And his wife, the wood-carrier,

Text1: And shake the trunk of the palm-tree toward thee, thou wilt cause ripe dates to fall upon thee.
Text2: And hoarded (wealth) and withheld it.

Text1: They ask you what has been made lawful to them. Say: 'All clean things have been made lawful to you, and such hunting animals as you teach, training them to hunt, teaching them the knowledge Allah has given you - you may eat what they catch for you - but invoke the name of Allah on it. Have fear of Allah (in violating His Law). Allah is swift in His reckoning.'
Text2: And how is it that you do not eat of that over which Allah's name has been pronounced even though He has clearly spelled out to you what He has forbidden you unless you are constrained to it? Many indeed say misleading things without knowledge, driven merely by their lowly desires. But your Lord knows well the transgressors.

Text1: The month of Ramadan in which was revealed the Quran, a guidance for mankind, and clear proofs of the guidance, and the Criterion (of right and wrong). And whosoever of you is present, let him fast the month, and whosoever of you is sick or on a journey, (let him fast the same) number of other days. Allah desireth for you ease; He desireth not hardship for you; and (He desireth) that ye should complete the period, and that ye should magnify Allah for having guided you, and that peradventure ye may be thankful.
Text2: And how many a community have We destroyed that was thankless for its means of livelihood! And yonder are their dwellings, which have not been inhabited after them save a little. And We, even We, were the inheritors.

Text1: Establish worship at the going down of the sun until the dark of night, and (the recital of) the Quran at dawn. Lo! (the recital of) the Quran at dawn is ever witnessed.
Text2: And how many a community revolted against the ordinance of its Lord and His messengers, and We called it to a stern account and punished it with dire punishment,

Text1: Lo! Abraham was mild, imploring, penitent.
Text2: And how many a generation We destroyed before them, who were mightier than these in prowess so that they overran the lands! Had they any place of refuge (when the judgment came)?

Text1: But they said: _Lord, make the stages of our journeys longer.ù They wronged their own selves so We reduced them to bygone tales, and utterly tore them to pieces. Verily there are Signs in this for everyone who is steadfast and thankful.
Text2: And how many a town did We destroy whose inhabitants exulted on account of their affluence. These are their dwellings in which very few dwelt after them. Eventually it is We Who inherited them.

Text1: How many a township We have destroyed! Our scourge fell upon them at night, or when they were taking midday rest.
Text2: And how many a town did We destroy whose inhabitants exulted on account of their affluence. These are their dwellings in which very few dwelt after them. Eventually it is We Who inherited them.

Text1: And when the Truth from Our presence came unto them, they said: Lo! this is mere magic.
Text2: And how many a township stronger than thy township (O Muhammad) which hath cast thee out, have We destroyed, and they had no helper!

Text1: Those who swallow usury cannot rise up save as he ariseth whom the devil hath prostrated by (his) touch. That is because they say: Trade is just like usury; whereas Allah permitteth trading and forbiddeth usury. He unto whom an admonition from his Lord cometh, and (he) refraineth (in obedience thereto), he shall keep (the profits of) that which is past, and his affair (henceforth) is with Allah. As for him who returneth (to usury) - Such are rightful owners of the Fire. They will abide therein.
Text2: And how many an animal there is that beareth not its own provision! Allah provideth for it and for you. He is the Hearer, the Knower.

Text1: Then, when the bearer of glad tidings came, he laid it on his face and he became a seer once more. He said: Said I not unto you that I know from Allah that which ye know not?
Text2: And how many angels are in the heavens whose intercession availeth naught save after Allah giveth leave to whom He chooseth and accepteth.

Text1: He said: O Adam! Inform them of their names, and when he had informed them of their names, He said: Did I not tell you that I know the secret of the heavens and the earth? And I know that which ye disclose and which ye hide.
Text2: And how they say that which they do not?

Text1: It is He Who has made the earth a bed for you and the sky a canopy; and it is He Who sends down rain from above for the growth of every kind of food products for your sustenance. So, when you know this, you should not set up equals to rank with Allah.
Text2: and human beings too, and beasts, and cattle -- diverse are their hues. From among His servants, it is only those who know that fear Allah. Verily Allah is Most Mighty, Most Forgiving.

Text1: He hath no partner. This am I commanded, and I am first of those who surrender (unto Him).
Text2: And I am commanded to be the first of those who are muslims (surrender unto Him).

Text1: And We sent Jesus, the son of Mary, after those Prophets, confirming the truth of whatever there still remained of the Torah. And We gave him the Gospel, wherein is guidance and light, and which confirms the truth of whatever there still remained of the Torah, and a guidance and admonition for the God-fearing.
Text2: And I have come to confirm the truth of whatever there still remains of the Torah, and to make lawful to you some of the things which had been forbidden to you. have come to you with a sign from your Lord; so have fear of Allah and obey me.

Text1: Gardens of Eden, which the Beneficent hath promised to His slaves in the unseen. Lo! His promise is ever sure of fulfilment -
Text2: And I have said: Seek pardon of your Lord. Lo! He was ever Forgiving.

Text1: That Allah may reward them with the best of what they did, and increase reward for them of His bounty. Allah giveth blessings without stint to whom He will.
Text2: And I plot a plot (against them).

Text1: When their brother Lot said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)?
Text2: And I shall not worship that which ye worship.

Text1: Lo! those who disbelieve after their (profession of) belief, and afterward grow violent in disbelief: their repentance will not be accepted. And such are those who are astray.
Text2: And if a wave enshroudeth them like awnings, they cry unto Allah, making their faith pure for Him only. But when He bringeth them safe to land, some of them compromise. None denieth Our signs save every traitor ingrate.

Text1: And those who deny Our revelations - step by step We lead them on from whence they know not.
Text2: And if a whisper from the devil reach thee (O Muhammad) then seek refuge in Allah. Lo! He is the Hearer, the Knower.

Text1: And whoso seeketh as religion other than the Surrender (to Allah) it will not be accepted from him, and he will be a loser in the Hereafter.
Text2: And if all the trees in the earth were pens, and the sea, with seven more seas to help it, (were ink), the words of Allah could not be exhausted. Lo! Allah is Mighty, Wise.

Text1: Then lo! thy Lord - for those who became fugitives after they had been persecuted, and then fought and were steadfast - lo! thy Lord afterward is (for them) indeed Forgiving, Merciful.
Text2: And if Allah had not decreed migration for them, He verily would have punished them in the world, and theirs in the Hereafter is the punishment of the Fire.

Text1: Be not as those who say, we hear, and they hear not.
Text2: And if Allah were to enlarge the provision for His slaves they would surely rebel in the earth, but He sendeth down by measure as He willeth. Lo! He is Informed, a Seer of His bondmen.

Text1: (And it will be said unto him): Read thy Book. Thy soul sufficeth as reckoner against thee this day.
Text2: And if any of your wives have gone from you unto the disbelievers and afterward ye have your turn (of triumph), then give unto those whose wives have gone the like of that which they have spent, and keep your duty to Allah in Whom ye are believers.

Text1: He will never enjoin you to take the angels or Prophets for your lords. Will he enjoin upon you unbelief when you have submitted yourselves to Allah?
Text2: And if anyone of them were to claim: "Indeed I am a god apart from Him," We shall recompense both with Hell. Thus do We recompense the wrong-doers.

Text1: The Messiah neither did disdain to be a servant of Allah nor do the angels who are stationed near to Him; and whoever disdains to serve Him, and waxes arrogant, Allah will certainly muster them all to Him.
Text2: And if anyone of them were to claim: "Indeed I am a god apart from Him," We shall recompense both with Hell. Thus do We recompense the wrong-doers.

Text1: Say: Though the sea became ink for the Words of my Lord, verily the sea would be used up before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even though We brought the like thereof to help.
Text2: And if he had invented false sayings concerning Us,

Text1: They fear their Lord above them, and do what they are bidden.
Text2: And if he is of those on the right hand,

Text1: It is not (possible) for any human being unto whom Allah had given the Scripture and wisdom and the prophethood that he should afterwards have said unto mankind: Be slaves of me instead of Allah; but (what he said was): Be ye faithful servants of the Lord by virtue of your constant teaching of the Scripture and of your constant study thereof.
Text2: And if it be said unto them: Follow that which Allah hath revealed, they say: Nay, but we follow that wherein we found our fathers. What! Even though the devil were inviting them unto the doom of flame?

Text1: And if you are prompted by a provocation from Satan, seek refuge with Allah. He, and He alone, is All-Hearing, All- Knowing.
Text2: And if it happens that a prompting from Satan should stir you up, seek refuge with Allah. He is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

Text1: And remember [O Prophet] your Lord in your mind, with humility and fear, and without raising your voice; remember Him in the morning and evening, and do not become of those who are negligent.
Text2: And if My servants ask you, O Prophet. concerning Me, tell them that I am quite near to them. I hear and answer the prayer of the suppliant, when he calls to Me. So let them respond to My call and believe in Me. Convey this to them, O Prophet; perhaps they may be guided aright.

Text1: And to Thamud We sent their brother Sali'h. He said: 'My people! Serve Allah; you have no god other than Him. He brought you into being out of the earth, and has made you dwell in it. So ask Him to forgive you, and do turn towards Him in repentance. Indeed My Lord is near, responsive to prayers.
Text2: And if My servants ask you, O Prophet. concerning Me, tell them that I am quite near to them. I hear and answer the prayer of the suppliant, when he calls to Me. So let them respond to My call and believe in Me. Convey this to them, O Prophet; perhaps they may be guided aright.

Text1: Their Lord answered the Prayer thus: "I will not suffer the work of any of you, whether male or female, to go to waste; each of you is from the other. Those who emigrated and were driven out from their homesteads and were persecuted in My cause, and who fought and were slain, indeed I shall wipe out their evil deeds from them and shall certainly admit them to the gardens beneath which rivers flow." This is their reward with their Lord; and with Allah lies the best reward.
Text2: And if My servants ask you, O Prophet. concerning Me, tell them that I am quite near to them. I hear and answer the prayer of the suppliant, when he calls to Me. So let them respond to My call and believe in Me. Convey this to them, O Prophet; perhaps they may be guided aright.

Text1: O Prophet! Allah is Sufficient for thee and those who follow thee of the believers.
Text2: And if one of them hath tidings of that which he likeneth to the Beneficent One, his countenance becometh black and he is full of inward rage.

Text1: And (also) those who spend their wealth in order to be seen of men, and believe not in Allah nor the Last Day. Whoso taketh Satan for a comrade, a bad comrade hath he.
Text2: And if Our revelations are recited unto them in plain terms, they say: This is naught else than a man who would turn you away from what your fathers used to worship; and they say: This is naught else than an invented lie. Those who disbelieve say of the truth when it reacheth them: This is naught else than mere magic.

Text1: And if ye are in doubt concerning that which We reveal unto Our slave (Muhammad), then produce a surah of the like thereof, and call your witness beside Allah if ye are truthful.
Text2: And if they (thy kinsfolk) disobey thee, say: Lo! I am innocent of what they do.

Text1: It is not righteousness that ye turn your faces to the East and the West; but righteous is he who believeth in Allah and the Last Day and the angels and the Scripture and the prophets; and giveth wealth, for love of Him, to kinsfolk and to orphans and the needy and the wayfarer and to those who ask, and to set slaves free; and observeth proper worship and payeth the poor-due. And those who keep their treaty when they make one, and the patient in tribulation and adversity and time of stress. Such are they who are sincere. Such are the Allah-fearing.
Text2: And if they answer thee not, then know that what they follow is their lusts. And who goeth farther astray than he who followeth his lust without guidance from Allah. Lo! Allah guideth not wrongdoing folk.

Text1: Gardens of Eden which they enter, along with all who do right of their fathers and their helpmeets and their seed. The angels enter unto them from every gate,
Text2: And if they behold a portent they turn away and say: Prolonged illusion.

Text1: Or have they even a share in the Sovereignty? Then in that case, they would not give mankind even the speck on a date-stone.
Text2: And if they deny thee, (O Muhammad), messengers (of Allah) were denied before thee. Unto Allah all things are brought back.

Text1: Let those fight in the way of Allah who sell the life of this world for the other. Whoso fighteth in the way of Allah, be he slain or be he victorious, on him We shall bestow a vast reward.
Text2: And if they deny thee, those before them also denied. Their messengers came unto them with clear proofs (of Allah_s Sovereignty), and with the Psalms and the Scripture giving light.

Text1: That ye serve none, save Allah. Lo! I fear for you the retribution of a painful Day.
Text2: And if they had had patience till thou camest forth unto them, it had been better for them. And Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

Text1: (This being so, O Muhammad), call people to the same religion and be steadfast about it as you were commanded, and do not follow their desires, and say (to them): _I believe in the Book Allah has sent down. I have been commanded to establish justice among you. Allah is our Lord and your Lord. We have our deeds and you have your deeds. There is no contention between us and you. Allah will bring us all together. To Him all are destined to return.ù
Text2: And if they reject you as false, tell them: 'My deeds are for myself and your deeds for yourselves. You will not be held responsible for my deeds, nor I for your deeds.

Text1: If they turn away, say to them: "I have warned you all alike; and I cannot say whether what you have been promised is near or distant.
Text2: And if they reject you as false, tell them: 'My deeds are for myself and your deeds for yourselves. You will not be held responsible for my deeds, nor I for your deeds.

Text1: O Prophet, say to them, "Do you argue with us concerning AIIah, whereas He is our Lord and also your Lord? We shall be accountable to Him for our deeds and you for yours; so we have dedicated our worship to Him alone.
Text2: And if they reject you as false, tell them: 'My deeds are for myself and your deeds for yourselves. You will not be held responsible for my deeds, nor I for your deeds.

Text1: To you is your religion, and to me, my religion.
Text2: And if they reject you as false, tell them: 'My deeds are for myself and your deeds for yourselves. You will not be held responsible for my deeds, nor I for your deeds.

Text1: O Prophet, say to them, "Do you argue with us concerning AIIah, whereas He is our Lord and also your Lord? We shall be accountable to Him for our deeds and you for yours; so we have dedicated our worship to Him alone.
Text2: And if they remonstrate with you, tell them: 'I have submitted my whole being to Allah, and so have those who follow me.' And ask the People of the Book as well as those who follow no heavenly Scripture: 'Have you also submitted (to Allah)?' If they have submitted to Him, they are indeed on the right way but if they deviate from submitting to Allah, then your duty is merely to deliver the message. Allah observes the affairs of His servants.

Text1: And when they opened their belongings they discovered that their merchandise had been returned to them. They said: O our father! What (more) can we ask? Here is our merchandise returned to us. We shall get provision for our folk and guard our brother, and we shall have the extra measure of a camel (load). This (that we bring now) is a light measure.
Text2: And if they were to see a fragment of the heaven falling, they would say: A heap of clouds.

Text1: And if they answer not your prayer, then know that it is revealed only in the knowledge of Allah; and that there is no Allah save Him. Will ye then be (of) those who surrender?
Text2: And if those who disbelieve join battle with you they will take to flight, and afterward they will find no protecting friend nor helper.

Text1: Those of them with whom thou madest a treaty, and then at every opportunity they break their treaty, and they keep not duty (to Allah).
Text2: And if thou (Muhammad) ask them: Who created the heavens and the earth, they will surely answer: The Mighty, the Knower created them;

Text1: (How much more seemly) had they been content with that which Allah and His messenger had given them and had said: Allah sufficeth us. Allah will give us of His bounty, and (also) His messenger. Unto Allah we are suppliants.
Text2: And if thou ask them who created them, they will surely say: Allah. How then are they turned away?

Text1: O ye who believe! Observe your duty to Allah, and give up what remaineth (due to you) from usury, if ye are (in truth) believers.
Text2: And if thou wert to ask them: Who causeth water to come down from the sky, and therewith reviveth the earth after its death? they verily would say: Allah. Say: Praise be to Allah! But most of them have no sense.

Text1: Allah hath blighted usury and made almsgiving fruitful. Allah loveth not the impious and guilty.
Text2: And if thou wert to ask them: Who created the heavens and the earth, and constrained the sun and the moon (to their appointed work)? they would say: Allah. How then are they turned away?

Text1: And, O my people! who would deliver me from Allah if I thrust them away? Will ye not then reflect?
Text2: And if two parties of believers fall to fighting, then make peace between them. And if one party of them doeth wrong to the other, fight ye that which doeth wrong till it return unto the ordinance of Allah; then, if it return, make peace between them justly, and act equitably. Lo! Allah loveth the equitable.

Text1: He replied: "All this has been given to me on account of a certain knowledge that I have." Did he not know that Allah had destroyed before him those who were stronger in might than he and were more numerous in multitude? The wicked are not asked about their acts of sin.
Text2: And if We bestow Our Mercy upon him after hardship, he will surely say: _This is what I truly deserve, and I do not believe that the Hour (of Resurrection) will ever come to pass; and if I am returned to my Lord, there too I shall enjoy the best.ù Surely We shall fully apprise the unbelievers of what they have done, and We shall certainly make them taste a severe chastisement.

Text1: Nor do I believe that the Hour of Resurrection will ever come to pass. And even if I am returned to my Lord, I shall find a better place than this."
Text2: And if We bestow Our Mercy upon him after hardship, he will surely say: _This is what I truly deserve, and I do not believe that the Hour (of Resurrection) will ever come to pass; and if I am returned to my Lord, there too I shall enjoy the best.ù Surely We shall fully apprise the unbelievers of what they have done, and We shall certainly make them taste a severe chastisement.

Text1: They assign to Allah what they dislike for themselves and their tongues utter a sheer lie in stating that a happy state awaits them. Without doubt the Fire awaits them and it is to it that they shall be hastened.
Text2: And if We bestow Our Mercy upon him after hardship, he will surely say: _This is what I truly deserve, and I do not believe that the Hour (of Resurrection) will ever come to pass; and if I am returned to my Lord, there too I shall enjoy the best.ù Surely We shall fully apprise the unbelievers of what they have done, and We shall certainly make them taste a severe chastisement.

Text1: But when He gave unto them aright, they ascribed unto Him partners in respect of that which He had given them. High is He Exalted above all that they associate (with Him).
Text2: And if We had appointed it a Lecture in a foreign tongue they would assuredly have said: If only its verses were expounded (so that we might understand)? What! A foreign tongue and an Arab? - Say unto them (O Muhammad): For those who believe it is a guidance and a healing; and as for those who disbelieve, there is a deafness in their ears, and it is blindness for them. Such are called to from afar.

Text1: These depend on guidance from their Lord. These are the successful.
Text2: And if We had revealed it unto one of any other nation than the Arabs,

Text1: And be ye not as those who separated and disputed after the clear proofs had come unto them. For such there is an awful doom,
Text2: And if We had so willed, We could have given every soul its guidance, but the word from Me concerning evildoers took effect: that I will fill hell with the jinn and mankind together.

Text1: When We make people have a taste of Our Mercy, they exult in it; and when any misfortune befalls them in consequence of their deeds, then lo and behold, they despair.
Text2: And if We let him taste favour after harm has touched him, he says: 'All my ills are gone', and he suddenly becomes exultant and boastful,

Text1: Whenever We bestow favours upon man, he arrogantly turns away and draws aside; and whenever evil visits him, he is in utter despair.
Text2: And if We let him taste favour after harm has touched him, he says: 'All my ills are gone', and he suddenly becomes exultant and boastful,

Text1: And will make him a messenger unto the Children of Israel, (saying): Lo! I come unto you with a sign from your Lord. Lo! I fashion for you out of clay the likeness of a bird, and I breathe into it and it is a bird, by Allah_s leave. I heal him who was born blind, and the leper, and I raise the dead, by Allah_s leave. And I announce unto you what ye eat and what ye store up in your houses. Lo! herein verily is a portent for you, if ye are to be believers.
Text2: And if We sent a wind and they beheld it yellow, they verily would still continue in their disbelief.
