So saying, Allah asked: 'Do you agree and accept to take up the burden of the covenant?' They answered: 'We agree,' He said: 'Then bear wirness; and I will be with you among the witness.

Text1: You have already come across an instructive sign in the two hosts that encountered each other in battle (at Badr): one host fighting in the way of Allah, and the other that of unbelievers. They saw with their own eyes that one host was twice the number of the other. But (the result of the battle has proved that) Allah succours with His victory whomsoever He wills. In this there is surely a lesson for all who have eyes to see.
Text2: And recall when He made them appear as few in your eyes when you met them in the battle just as He lessened you in their eyes so that Allah might accomplish what had been decreed. To Allah are all matters referred for decision.

Text1: And of the cattle (He has reared) some for burden, and some whose flesh you eat and whose skins and hair you use to spread the ground. Eat of the sustenance Allah has provided you and do not follow in the footsteps of Satan, for surely he is your open enemy.
Text2: And recall when We said to the angels: "Prostrate yourselves before Adam"; all of them fell prostrate, except Iblis. He was of the jinn and so disobeyed the command of his Lord. Will you, then, take him and his progeny as your guardians rather than Me although they are your open enemies? What an evil substitute are these wrong-doers taking!

Text1: And yet, some people have come to associate the jinn with Allah in His divinity, even though it is He Who created them; and in ignorance they impute to Him sons and daughters. He is Holy and Exalted far above that which they attribute to Him.
Text2: And recall when We said to the angels: "Prostrate yourselves before Adam"; all of them fell prostrate, except Iblis. He was of the jinn and so disobeyed the command of his Lord. Will you, then, take him and his progeny as your guardians rather than Me although they are your open enemies? What an evil substitute are these wrong-doers taking!

Text1: Children of Adam! Let not Satan deceive you in the manner he deceived your parents out of Paradise, pulling off from them their clothing to reveal to them their shame. He and his host surely see you from whence you do not see them. We have made satans the guardians of those who do not believe.
Text2: And recall when We said to the angels: "Prostrate yourselves before Adam"; all of them fell prostrate, except Iblis. He was of the jinn and so disobeyed the command of his Lord. Will you, then, take him and his progeny as your guardians rather than Me although they are your open enemies? What an evil substitute are these wrong-doers taking!

Text1: O people, eat of what is lawful and clean in the earth and do not follow the ways of Satan, for he is your avowed enemy.
Text2: And recall when We said to the angels: "Prostrate yourselves before Adam"; all of them fell prostrate, except Iblis. He was of the jinn and so disobeyed the command of his Lord. Will you, then, take him and his progeny as your guardians rather than Me although they are your open enemies? What an evil substitute are these wrong-doers taking!

Text1: Surely Satan is an enemy to you. Therefore, do take him as an enemy. He calls his followers to his way so that they may be among the inmates of the Fire.
Text2: And recall when We said to the angels: "Prostrate yourselves before Adam"; all of them fell prostrate, except Iblis. He was of the jinn and so disobeyed the command of his Lord. Will you, then, take him and his progeny as your guardians rather than Me although they are your open enemies? What an evil substitute are these wrong-doers taking!

Text1: Then We commanded the angels, "Bow yourselves to Adam. "All bowed but Iblis refused to do so; he waxed proud and joined the defiers.
Text2: And recall when We said to the angels: "Prostrate yourselves before Adam"; all of them fell prostrate, except Iblis. He was of the jinn and so disobeyed the command of his Lord. Will you, then, take him and his progeny as your guardians rather than Me although they are your open enemies? What an evil substitute are these wrong-doers taking!

Text1: and We raised the Mount high above them and took from them a covenant (to obey the commandment), and ordered them: 'Enter the gate in the state of prostration.' And We said to them: 'Do not violate the law of the Sabbath', and took from them a firm covenant.
Text2: And recall when We shook the mountain over them as though it were a canopy, and they thought that it was going to fall over them; and We said: 'Hold firmly to that which We have given you, and remember what is in it, that you may guard against evil.

Text1: Call to mind the time when We raised above you the Tur and made a covenant with you, saying, "Hold fast to the Book which We are giving you and bear in mind the commands and precepts contained therein. It is expected that this will lead you on to the paths of virtue and piety."
Text2: And recall when We shook the mountain over them as though it were a canopy, and they thought that it was going to fall over them; and We said: 'Hold firmly to that which We have given you, and remember what is in it, that you may guard against evil.

Text1: You have already come across an instructive sign in the two hosts that encountered each other in battle (at Badr): one host fighting in the way of Allah, and the other that of unbelievers. They saw with their own eyes that one host was twice the number of the other. But (the result of the battle has proved that) Allah succours with His victory whomsoever He wills. In this there is surely a lesson for all who have eyes to see.
Text2: And recall when you were encamped at the nearer end of the valley (of Badr) and they were at the farther end and the caravan below you (along the seaside). Had you made a mutual appointment to meet in encounter, you would have declined. But encounter was brought about so that Allah might accomplish what He had decreed, and that he who was to perish should perish through a clear proof, and who was to survive might survive through a clear proof. Surely Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

Text1: Allah has promised to those among you who believe and do righteous deeds, that He will make them successors in the land just as He made those who passed away before them, and that He will establish their religion, which He has approved for them, on strong foundations and will change their (present) state of fear into peace and security. Let them worship Me and associate none with Me; and the one who disbelieves after this," shall be of those who are perverse transgressors.
Text2: And recall when you were few in numbers and deemed weak in the land, fearful lest people do away with you. Then He provided you refuge, strengthened you with His help, and provided you sustenance with good things that you may be grateful.

Text1: Also call to mind when your Lord proclaimed: "If you give thanks, I will certainly grant you more; but if you are ungrateful for My favours, My chastisement is terrible.
Text2: And recall when Your Lord proclaimed that 'He would continually set in authority over them, till the Day of Judgement, those who would ruthless oppress thern.' Surely, your Lord is swift in chastising; and yet He is All-Forgiving, All-Merciful.

Text1: They challenge you to hasten the coming of evil upon them before the coming of any good, although people who followed a like course before had met with exemplary punishment (from Allah). Verily your Lord is forgiving to mankind despite all their wrong-doing. Verily your Lord is also severe in retribution.
Text2: And recall when Your Lord proclaimed that 'He would continually set in authority over them, till the Day of Judgement, those who would ruthless oppress thern.' Surely, your Lord is swift in chastising; and yet He is All-Forgiving, All-Merciful.

Text1: and when he was old enough to go about and work with him, (one day) Abraham said to him: _My son, I see in my dream that I am slaughtering you. So consider (and tell me) what you think.ù He said: _Do as you are bidden. You will find me, if Allah so wills, among the steadfast.ù
Text2: And recite in the Book the account of Ishmael. He was ever true to his promise, and was a Messenger, a Prophet.

Text1: Call upon your Lord with humility and in secret. Surely He does not love transgressors.
Text2: And remember [O Prophet] your Lord in your mind, with humility and fear, and without raising your voice; remember Him in the morning and evening, and do not become of those who are negligent.

Text1: And call to mind when Abraham prayed: "My Lord! Make this city secure, and keep me and my sons away from worshipping the idols.
Text2: And remember that Abraham prayed, "Lord, make this city a city of peace and security, and provide with every kind of fruit those of its people, who believe in Allah and the Last Day'. Allah answered, "As for the disbelievers, I will also provide them with the necessities of life in this world, though in the Next World I will drag them to the torment of Hell, and that is the worst abode."

Text1: Call to mind when We assigned to Abraham the site of the House (Kabah), directing him: "Do not associate aught with Me" and "Keep My House pure for those who walk around it, and for those who stand and who bow down and who prostrate themselves (in worship),
Text2: And remember that We made this House (the Ka'bah) the centre and sanctuary for mankind and enjoined the people to dedicate to worship the place where Abraham used to stand for prayer, and We urged Abraham and Ismail to keep My House pure for those who would go round it and those who would retire to it for devotion and prayer and for those who would bow down and prostrate themselves there in worhsip.

Text1: In it there are clear signs and the station of Abraham; whoever enters it becomes secure. Pilgrimage to the House is a duty owed to Allah by all who can make their way to it. As for those who refuse to follow His command, surely Allah does not stand in need of anything.
Text2: And remember that We made this House (the Ka'bah) the centre and sanctuary for mankind and enjoined the people to dedicate to worship the place where Abraham used to stand for prayer, and We urged Abraham and Ismail to keep My House pure for those who would go round it and those who would retire to it for devotion and prayer and for those who would bow down and prostrate themselves there in worhsip.

Text1: Say: Obey Allah and obey the messenger. But if ye turn away, then (it is) for him (to do) only that wherewith he hath been charged, and for you (to do) only that wherewith ye have been charged. If ye obey him, ye will go aright. But the messenger hath no other charge than to convey (the message) plainly.
Text2: And remembereth the name of his Lord, so prayeth,

Text1: and also celebrate His praise at night, and at the retreat of the stars.
Text2: And rise from sleep during the night as well- this is an additional Prayer for you. Possibly your Lord will raise you to an honoured position.

Text1: and in the night, too, celebrate His glory, in the wake of prostration.
Text2: And rise from sleep during the night as well- this is an additional Prayer for you. Possibly your Lord will raise you to an honoured position.

Text1: and prostrate yourself before Him at night, and extol His Glory during the long watches of the night.
Text2: And rise from sleep during the night as well- this is an additional Prayer for you. Possibly your Lord will raise you to an honoured position.

Text1: Stand up in Prayer by night, all but a small part of it;
Text2: And rise from sleep during the night as well- this is an additional Prayer for you. Possibly your Lord will raise you to an honoured position.

Text1: And afterward, when He hath rid you of the misfortune, behold! a set of you attribute partners to their Lord,
Text2: And roasting at hell-fire.

Text1: Allah said: 'Go down; you are enemies one of the other. For you there is dwelling and provision on the earth for a while.'
Text2: and said: "Get down, both of you, (that is, man and Satan), and be out of it; each of you shall be an enemy to the other. Henceforth if there comes to you a guidance from Me, then whosoever follows My guidance shall neither go astray nor suffer misery.

Text1: We said, "Now go down, all of you from here. Henceforth there shall come to you Guidance from Me now and again: whoever will follow it shall have neither fear nor sorrow
Text2: and said: "Get down, both of you, (that is, man and Satan), and be out of it; each of you shall be an enemy to the other. Henceforth if there comes to you a guidance from Me, then whosoever follows My guidance shall neither go astray nor suffer misery.

Text1: They will wish to come forth from the Fire, but they will not come forth from it. Theirs will be a lasting doom.
Text2: And said: Shall we forsake our gods for a mad poet?

Text1: Who hath appointed the earth as a bed and hath threaded roads for you therein and hath sent down water from the sky and thereby We have brought forth divers kinds of vegetation,
Text2: And said: This is naught else than magic from of old;

Text1: As for those of your women who are guilty of lewdness, call to witness four of you against them. And if they testify (to the truth of the allegation) then confine them to the houses until death take them or (until) Allah appoint for them a way (through new legislation).
Text2: And Satan indeed found his calculation true concerning them, for they follow him, all save a group of true believers.

Text1: And when Allah saith: O Jesus, son of Mary! Didst thou say unto mankind: Take me and my mother for two gods beside Allah? he saith: Be glorified! It was not mine to utter that to which I had no right. If I used to say it, then Thou knewest it. Thou knowest what is in my mind, and I know not what is in Thy Mind. Lo! Thou, only Thou, art the Knower of Things Hidden?
Text2: And saved them and their people from the great distress,

Text1: Lo! those who believe (this revelation), and those who are Jews, and the Sabaeans and the Christians and the Magians and the idolaters - Lo! Allah will decide between them on the Day of Resurrection. Lo! Allah is Witness over all things.
Text2: And say (unto him): Hast thou (will) to grow (in grace)?

Text1: O my people! Go into the holy land which Allah hath ordained for you. Turn not in flight, for surely ye turn back as losers:
Text2: And say: Ah, woe for us! This is the Day of Judgment.

Text1: And the Jews say: Ezra is the son of Allah, and the Christians say: The Messiah is the son of Allah. That is their saying with their mouths. They imitate the saying of those who disbelieved of old. Allah (Himself) fighteth against them. How perverse are they!
Text2: And say: Are our gods better, or is he? They raise not the objection save for argument. Nay! but they are a contentious folk.

Text1: And when Abraham and Ishmael were raising the foundations of the House, (Abraham prayed): Our Lord! Accept from us (this duty). Lo! Thou, only Thou, art the Hearer, the Knower.
Text2: And say: Praise be to Allah Who will show you His portents so that ye shall know them. And thy Lord is not unaware of what ye (mortals) do.

Text1: O ye unto whom the Scripture hath been given! Believe in what We have revealed confirming that which ye possess, before We destroy countenances so as to confound them, or curse them as We cursed the Sabbath-breakers (of old time). The commandment of Allah is always executed.
Text2: And say: We (now) believe therein. But how can they reach (faith) from afar off,

Text1: Ask forgiveness for them (O Muhammad), or ask not forgiveness for them; though thou ask forgiveness for them seventy times Allah will not forgive them. That is because they disbelieved in Allah and His messenger, and Allah guideth not wrongdoing folk.
Text2: And saying: Be not proud against Allah. Lo! I bring you a clear warrant.

Text1: It was but the guilty who misled us.
Text2: And scouring to the raid at dawn,

Text1: O People of the Scripture! Now hath Our messenger come unto you, expounding unto you much of that which ye used to hide in the Scripture, and forgiving much. now hath come unto you light from Allah and plain Scripture,
Text2: And seek to scoff when they behold a portent.

Text1: (The tribe of) Thamud denied the messengers (of Allah)
Text2: And send against them swarms of flying creatures,

Text1: Send him with us to-morrow that he may enjoy himself and play. And lo! we shall take good care of him.
Text2: And set not any other god along with Allah; lo! I am a plain warner unto you from Him.

Text1: He created the heavens and the earth with Truth and shaped you, giving you excellent shapes. And to Him is your ultimate return.
Text2: and set you in whatever form He pleased?

Text1: He hath created the heavens and the earth with truth. High be He Exalted above all that they associate (with Him).
Text2: And shadow of black smoke,

Text1: And yet, some people have come to associate the jinn with Allah in His divinity, even though it is He Who created them; and in ignorance they impute to Him sons and daughters. He is Holy and Exalted far above that which they attribute to Him.
Text2: and shall lead them astray, and shall engross them in vain desires, and I shall command them and they will cut off the ears of the cattle, and I shall command them and they will disfigure Allah's creation.' He who took Satan rather than Allah for his guardian has indeed suffered a man-ifest loss.

Text1: (On the contrary) only those who have deserved the Garden, will have a good abode on that Day and a cool place for midday rest.
Text2: and shall return to his people joyfully.

Text1: (We take our) colour from Allah, and who is better than Allah at colouring. We are His worshippers.
Text2: And she said unto his sister: Trace him. So she observed him from afar, and they perceived not.

Text1: Hold fast together to the cable of Allah and be not divided. Remember the blessing that Allah bestowed upon you: you were once enemies then He brought your hearts together, so that through His blessing you became brothers. You stood on the brink of a pit of fire and He delivered you from it. Thus Allah makes His signs clear to you that you may be guided to the right way.
Text2: And should they seek to deceive you, Allah is sufficient for you. He it is Who strengthened you with His succour and the believers

Text1: Lo! Thou art ever Seeing us.
Text2: And show not favour, seeking wordly gain!

Text1: Allah saith: This is a day in which their truthfulness profiteth the truthful, for theirs are Gardens underneath which rivers flow, wherein they are secure for ever, Allah taking pleasure in them and they in Him. That is the great triumph.
Text2: And showed them the right path.

Text1: Blessed is He Who, if He will, will assign thee better than (all) that - Gardens underneath which rivers flow - and will assign thee mansions.
Text2: And silken carpets spread.

Text1: Lo! now they fold up their breasts that they may hide (their thoughts) from Him. At the very moment when they cover themselves with their clothing, Allah knoweth that which they keep hidden and that which they proclaim. Lo! He is Aware of what is in the breasts (of men).
Text2: And so for him who believeth not in Allah and His messenger - Lo! We have prepared a flame for disbelievers.

Text1: Do not eat of (the animal) over which the name of Allah has not been pronounced (at the time of its slaughtering), for that is a transgression. And behold, the evil ones do inspire doubts and objections into the hearts of their friends so that they dispute with you; but if you obey them, you will surely yourselves turn into those who associate others with Allah in His divinity.
Text2: And so it is that against every Prophet We have set up the evil ones from among men and jinn, some of them inspire others with specious speech only by way of. delusion. Had it been your Lord's will, they would not have done it. Leave them alone to fabricate what they will.

Text1: O Muhammad, in this very way We have made the criminals the enemies of every Prophet, but your Lord suffices for you as your Guide and Helper.
Text2: And so it is that against every Prophet We have set up the evil ones from among men and jinn, some of them inspire others with specious speech only by way of. delusion. Had it been your Lord's will, they would not have done it. Leave them alone to fabricate what they will.

Text1: whether he be from the jinn or humans.ù
Text2: And so it is that against every Prophet We have set up the evil ones from among men and jinn, some of them inspire others with specious speech only by way of. delusion. Had it been your Lord's will, they would not have done it. Leave them alone to fabricate what they will.

Text1: But they charged him with falsehood. Thereupon We delivered Noah and those who were with him in the Ark, and caused those who rejected Our signs as false to be drowned. Surely they were a blind folk.
Text2: And so they were drowned on account of their sins, and then cast into the Fire, and did not find any other than Allah, to come forth to their help.

Text1: We bestowed upon David (an illustrious son), Solomon. How excellent a servant (of Ours he was)! Indeed he constantly turned to Us in devotion.
Text2: And Solomon succeeded David and said: "O people, we have been taught the speech of birds and we have been endowed with all kinds of things. Surely this is a conspicuous favour (from Allah)."

Text1: And when We brought you through the sea and rescued you, and drowned the folk of Pharaoh in your sight.
Text2: And Solomon was David_s heir. And he said: O mankind! Lo! we have been taught the language of birds, and have been given (abundance) of all things. This surely is evident favour.

Text1: Even if thou stretch out thy hand against me to kill me, I shall not stretch out my hand against thee to kill thee, lo! I fear Allah, the Lord of the Worlds.
Text2: And some of them draw near unto others, mutually questioning.

Text1: O ye who believe! Take not the Jews and the Christians for friends. They are friends one to another. He among you who taketh them for friends is (one) of them. Lo! Allah guideth not wrongdoing folk.
Text2: And some of them draw near unto others, mutually questioning.

Text1: (And when he came to Joseph in the prison, he exclaimed): Joseph! O thou truthful one! Expound for us the seven fat kine which seven lean were eating and the seven green ears of corn and other (seven) dry, that I may return unto the people, so that they may know.
Text2: And some of them draw near unto others, questioning,

Text1: Go, thou and thy brother, with My tokens, and be not faint in remembrance of Me.
Text2: And sons abiding in his presence

Text1: Or some created thing that is yet greater in your thoughts! Then they will say: Who shall bring us back (to life). Say: He Who created you at the first. Then will they shake their heads at thee, and say: When will it be? Say: It will perhaps be soon;
Text2: And spend of that wherewith We have provided you before death cometh unto one of you and he saith: My Lord! If only thou wouldst reprieve me for a little while, then I would give alms and be among the righteous.

Text1: (O Muhammad), warn mankind of the Day when a severe chastisement shall overtake them, and the wrong-doers will say: "Our Lord, grant us respite for a short while; we shall respond to Your call and will follow Your Messengers." (But they will be clearly told): "Are you not the same who swore earlier that they shall never suffer decline?"
Text2: And spend of what Allah has granted you by way of sustenance before death should come to any of you and he should say: _Lord, why did You not defer my return for a while so that I might give alms and be among the righteous?ù

Text1: that I have left behind. I am likely to do good." Nay, it is merely a word that he is uttering. There is a barrier behind all of them (who are dead) until the Day when they will be raised up.
Text2: And spend of what Allah has granted you by way of sustenance before death should come to any of you and he should say: _Lord, why did You not defer my return for a while so that I might give alms and be among the righteous?ù

Text1: And say: Lo! I, even I, am a plain warner,
Text2: And spreading shade,

Text1: Lo! those of you who turned back on the day when the two hosts met, Satan alone it was who caused them to backslide, because of some of that which they have earned. Now Allah hath forgiven them. Lo! Allah is Forgiving, Clement.
Text2: And stay in your houses. Bedizen not yourselves with the bedizenment of the Time of Ignorance. Be regular in prayer, and pay the poor-due, and obey Allah and His messenger. Allah_s wish is but to remove uncleanness far from you, O Folk of the Household, and cleanse you with a thorough cleansing.

Text1: He said: My Lord! I have control of none but myself and my brother, so distinguish between us and the wrong-doing folk.
Text2: And stop them, for they must be questioned.

Text1: The Lord of Moses and Aaron.
Text2: And strive to please thy Lord.

Text1: and extended shade,
Text2: And such will be the Paradise promised to the God-fearing: rivers will flow beneath it, its fruits will be eternal, and so will be its blissful shade. That is the ultimate destiny of the God-fearing while Fire is the destiny of the unbelievers.

Text1: This is Our provision for you, never to end.
Text2: And such will be the Paradise promised to the God-fearing: rivers will flow beneath it, its fruits will be eternal, and so will be its blissful shade. That is the ultimate destiny of the God-fearing while Fire is the destiny of the unbelievers.

Text1: He said: O son of my mother! Clutch not my beard nor my head! I feared lest thou shouldst say: Thou hast caused division among the Children of Israel, and hast not waited for my word.
Text2: And sun and moon are united,

Text1: And those who break the covenant of Allah after ratifying it, and sever that which Allah hath commanded should be joined, and make mischief in the earth: theirs is the curse and theirs the ill abode.
Text2: And surely there hath come unto them news whereof the purport should deter,

Text1: Surely Allah does not forgive that a partner be ascribed to Him, although He forgives any other sins for whomever He wills. He who associates anyone with Allah in His divinity has indeed forged a mighty lie and committed an awesome sin.
Text2: And surely they disbelieved when they said: 'Christ, the son of Mary, is indeed God'; whereas Christ had said: 'Children of Israel! Serve Allah, Who is your Lord and my Lord.' Allah has forbidden Paradise to those who associate anything with Him in His divinity and their refuge shall be the Fire. No one will be able to help such wrong-doers.

Text1: and that (the result of) his striving shall soon be seen,
Text2: And tell them, (O Prophet): "Keep working: Allah will behold your works and so will His Messenger and the believers; and you shall be brought back to Him Who knows that which is beyond the reach of perception and that which is within the reach of perception. He will then declare to you all that you have been doing."

Text1: On the day when they behold the angels, on that day there will be no good tidings for the guilty; and they will cry: A forbidding ban!
Text2: And ten nights,

Text1: Say (O Muhammad): O mankind! If ye are in doubt of my religion, then (know that) I worship not those whom ye worship instead of Allah, but I worship Allah Who causeth you to die, and I have been commanded to be of the believers.
Text2: And that Allah may help thee with strong help -

Text1: On that day no intercession availeth save (that of) him unto whom the Beneficent hath given leave and whose word He accepteth.
Text2: And that day will other faces be despondent,

Text1: (Those who obtain guidance to His light are found) in the houses which He has enjoined to raise up and to mention His name therein. In them such people glorify Him morning and evening
Text2: and that _mosques belong to Allah, so do not invoke anyone with Himù;

Text1: And if any is able to snatch a fragment, he is pursued by a piercing flame.
Text2: and that _we tried to pry (the secrets of) the heaven, but we found it full of terrible guards and shooting meteorsù;

Text1: Indeed they are debarred from even hearing it.
Text2: and that _we tried to pry (the secrets of) the heaven, but we found it full of terrible guards and shooting meteorsù;

Text1: And if any is able to snatch a fragment, he is pursued by a piercing flame.
Text2: and that _we would take up stations in the heaven to try to hear but anyone who now attempts to listen finds a shooting meteor in wait for himù;

Text1: Indeed they are debarred from even hearing it.
Text2: and that _we would take up stations in the heaven to try to hear but anyone who now attempts to listen finds a shooting meteor in wait for himù;

Text1: And in the Earth are neighbouring tracts, vineyards and ploughed lands, and date-palms, like and unlike, which are watered with one water. And we have made some of them to excel others in fruit. Lo! herein verily are portents for people who have sense.
Text2: And that He createth the two spouses, the male and the female,

Text1: He is the Knower of the Invisible and the Visible, the Great, the High Exalted.
Text2: And that He destroyed the former (tribe of) A_ad,

Text1: And they bid thee hasten on the evil rather than the good, when exemplary punishments have indeed occurred before them. But lo! thy Lord is rich in pardon for mankind despite their wrong, and lo! thy Lord is strong in punishment.
Text2: And that He hath ordained the second bringing forth;

Text1: Those who disbelieve say: If only some portent were sent down upon him from his Lord! Thou art a warner only, and for every folk a guide.
Text2: And that He it is Who enricheth and contenteth;

Text1: And He it is Who spread out the earth and placed therein firm hills and flowing streams, and of all fruits He placed therein two spouses (male and female). He covereth the night with the day. Lo! herein verily are portents for people who take thought.
Text2: And that He it is Who giveth death and giveth life;

Text1: Allah knoweth that which every female beareth and that which the wombs absorb and that which they grow. And everything with Him is measured.
Text2: And that He it is Who is the Lord of Sirius;

Text1: Allah it is Who raised up the heavens without visible supports, then mounted the Throne, and compelled the sun and the moon to be of service, each runneth unto an appointed term; He ordereth the course; He detaileth the revelations, that haply ye may be certain of the meeting with your Lord.
Text2: And that He it is who maketh laugh, and maketh weep,

Text1: Till, when the messengers despaired and thought that they were denied, then came unto them Our help, and whom We would was saved. And Our wrath cannot be warded from the guilty.
Text2: And that his effort will be seen.

Text1: We sent not before thee (any messengers) save men whom We inspired from among the folk of the townships - Have they not travelled in the land and seen the nature of the consequence for those who were before them? And verily the abode of the Hereafter, for those who ward off (evil), is best. Have ye then no sense? -
Text2: And that man hath only that for which he maketh effort,

Text1: Allah does not burden any human being with a responsibility heavier than he can bear. Everyone will enjoy the fruit of the good that one has earned and shall suffer for the evil that one has committed. (O Believers, pray like this to Allah: "Our Lord, take us not to task if we forget and lapse into error inadvertently. Lord! lay not on us the kind of burdens that You had lain on the people before us. Lord, lay not on us the kind of burden that we have not the strength to bear. Be kind to us, forgive us and show mercy to us. You are our Protector: help us against the disbelievers."
Text2: and that man shall have nothing but what he has striven for,

Text1: And when those who believe in Our revelations come unto thee, say: Peace be unto you! Your Lord hath prescribed for Himself mercy, that whoso of you doeth evil through ignorance and repenteth afterward thereof and doeth right, (for him) lo! He is Forgiving, Merciful.
Text2: And that Our host, they verily would be the victors.

Text1: Messengers before you have been given the lie to, and they endured with patience their being given the lie to and being persecuted until the time when Our help reached them. None has the power to alter the words of Allah. Indeed some account of the Messengers has already reached you.
Text2: and that Our hosts shall triumph.

Text1: those who were unjustly expelled from their homes for no other reason than their saying: "Allah is Our Lord." If Allah were not to repel some through others, monasteries and churches and synagogues and mosques wherein the name of Allah is much mentioned, would certainly have been pulled down. Allah will most certainly help those who will help Him. Verily Allah is Immensely Strong, Overwhelmingly Mighty.
Text2: and that Our hosts shall triumph.

Text1: Seest thou not that We have set the devils on the disbelievers to confound them with confusion?
Text2: And that the foolish one among us used to speak concerning Allah an atrocious lie.

Text1: O ye who believe! If ye keep your duty to Allah, He will give you discrimination (between right and wrong) and will rid you of your evil thoughts and deeds, and will forgive you. Allah is of Infinite Bounty.
Text2: And that those who argue concerning Our revelations may know they have no refuge.

Text1: And verily there had come unto them a messenger from among them, but they had denied him, and so the torment seized them while they were wrong-doers.
Text2: And that which Allah gave as spoil unto His messenger from them, ye urged not any horse or riding-camel for the sake thereof, but Allah giveth His messenger lordship over whom He will. Allah is Able to do all things.

Text1: Eventually they gave the lie to him and We destroyed them. Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.
Text2: and the Ad were destroyed by a furiously raging wind-storm

Text1: that He it is Who destroyed the ancient 'Ad,
Text2: and the Ad were destroyed by a furiously raging wind-storm

Text1: whereupon We sent upon them a fierce wind on inauspicious days that We might make them taste a degrading chastisement in the life of this world. And surely the chastisement of the Hereafter is even more degrading. There will be none to help them there.
Text2: and the Ad were destroyed by a furiously raging wind-storm

Text1: And when Our commandment came to pass We saved Hud and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us; We saved them from a harsh doom.
Text2: And the agony of death cometh in truth. (And it is said unto him): This is that which thou wast wont to shun.

Text1: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and there was beneath it a treasure belonging to them, and their father had been righteous, and thy Lord intended that they should come to their full strength and should bring forth their treasure as a mercy from their Lord; and I did it not upon my own command. Such is the interpretation of that wherewith thou couldst not bear.
Text2: And the angels will be on the sides thereof, and eight will uphold the Throne of thy Lord that day, above them.

Text1: On that Day, a cloud will appear rending the sky and the angels will be senthi down rank after rank.
Text2: and the angels will stand on the sides, with eight of them bearing aloft the Throne of your Lord on that Day.

Text1: The angels that bear the Throne and those that are around to extol your Lord's glory with His praise, they believe in Him, and ask forgiveness for the believers, saying: _Our Lord! You encompass everything with Your Mercy and Knowledge. So forgive those that repent and follow Your Path, and guard them against the chastisement of Hell.
Text2: and the angels will stand on the sides, with eight of them bearing aloft the Throne of your Lord on that Day.

Text1: You shall see the angels surrounding the Throne, glorifying their Lord with His praise, and judgement will have been made among them with fairness, and it will be proclaimed: _All praise and thanks be to Allah, the Lord of the whole Universe.ù
Text2: and the angels will stand on the sides, with eight of them bearing aloft the Throne of your Lord on that Day.

Text1: And He it is Who hath given independence to the two seas (though they meet); one palatable, sweet, and the other saltish, bitter; and hath set a bar and a forbidding ban between them.
Text2: And the begetter and that which he begat,

Text1: Those who believe and obscure not their belief by wrongdoing, theirs is safety; and they are rightly guided.
Text2: And the birds assembled; all were turning unto Him.

Text1: when the savage beasts shall be brought together,
Text2: and the birds, too, in their flocks, and turn again and again to celebrating Allah's glory.

Text1: Thus were they there defeated and brought low.
Text2: And the blind man and the seer are not equal, neither are those who believe and do good works (equal with) the evil-doer. Little do ye reflect!

Text1: Then We inspired in him, saying: Make the ship under Our eyes and Our inspiration. Then, when Our command cometh and the oven gusheth water, introduce therein of every (kind) two spouses, and thy household save him thereof against whom the Word hath already gone forth. And plead not with Me on behalf of those who have done wrong. Lo! they will be drowned.
Text2: And the breath of morning

Text1: He said: My Lord! Help me because they deny me.
Text2: And the close of night,

Text1: The Sabbath was appointed only for those who differed concerning it, and lo! thy Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that wherein they used to differ.
Text2: And the consequence for both will be that they are in the Fire, therein abiding. Such is the reward of evil-doers.

Text1: They are content that they should be with the useless and their hearts are sealed, so that they apprehend not.
Text2: And the cornlands and the goodly sites

Text1: They said: Lo! these are two wizards who would drive you out from your country by their magic, and destroy your best traditions;
Text2: And the dawn when it shineth forth,

Text1: And when thy Lord called Moses, saying: Go unto the wrongdoing folk,
Text2: And the day resplendent

Text1: And those who, when they are reminded of the revelations of their Lord, fall not deaf and blind thereat.
Text2: And the day when it revealeth him,

Text1: Criminals, separate yourselves from others today!
Text2: And the Day when We shall muster them all together, We shall say to those who associated others with Allah in His divinity: 'Keep to your places - you and those whom you associated with Allah.' Then We shall remove the veil of foreignness separating them. Those whom they had associated with Allah will say. 'It was not us that you worshipped.

Text1: But as for those in whose hearts is disease, it only addeth wickedness to their wickedness, and they die while they are disbelievers.
Text2: And the difference of night and day and the provision that Allah sendeth down from the sky and thereby quickeneth the earth after her death, and the ordering of the winds, are portents for a people who have sense.

Text1: They said: O Hud! Thou hast brought us no clear proof and we are not going to forsake our gods on thy (mere) saying, and we are not believers in thee.
Text2: And the dwellers in the wood, and the folk of Tubb_a: every one denied their messengers, therefor My threat took effect.

Text1: Abiding there for ever. Happy is it as abode and station!
Text2: And the earth and Him Who spread it,

Text1: The Day when the quaking will cause a violent convulsion,
Text2: and the earth and the mountains are carried aloft and are crushed to bits at one stroke,

Text1: As they come hurrying on in fear, their heads upraised, their gaze returning not to them, and their hearts as air.
Text2: And the earth hath He appointed for (His) creatures,

Text1: (One said): Kill Joseph or cast him to some (other) land, so that your father_s favour may be all for you, and (that) ye may afterward be righteous folk.
Text2: And the earth have We laid out, how gracious is the Spreader (thereof)!

Text1: He said: O Noah! Lo! he is not of thy household; lo! he is of evil conduct, so ask not of Me that whereof thou hast no knowledge. I admonish thee lest thou be among the ignorant.
Text2: And the earth have We spread out, and have flung firm hills therein, and have caused of every lovely kind to grow thereon,

Text1: (O mankind!) Call upon your Lord humbly and in secret. Lo! He loveth not aggressors.
Text2: And the earth shineth with the light of her Lord, and the Book is set up, and the prophets and the witnesses are brought, and it is judged between them with truth, and they are not wronged.

Text1: And verily We have sent down for you revelations that make plain, and the example of those who passed away before you. An admonition unto those who ward off (evil).
Text2: And the earth which splitteth (with the growth of trees and plants)

Text1: As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working on the river, and I wished to mar it, for there was a king behind them who is taking every ship by force.
Text2: And the earth with the mountains shall be lifted up and crushed with one crash,

Text1: Pray not that day for one destruction, but pray for many destructions!
Text2: And the earth, how it is spread?

Text1: And We shall turn unto the work they did and make it scattered motes.
Text2: And the Even and the Odd,

Text1: The similitude of the life of the world is only as water which We send down from the sky, then the earth_s growth of that which men and cattle eat mingleth with it till, when the earth hath taken on her ornaments and is embellished, and her people deem that they are masters of her, Our commandment cometh by night or by day and We make it as reaped corn as if it had not flourished yesterday. Thus do we expound the revelations for people who reflect.
Text2: And the evils of what they did will appear unto them, and that which they used to deride will befall them.

Text1: And every nation hath its term, and when its term cometh, they cannot put it off an hour nor yet advance (it).
Text2: And the evils that they earned will appear unto them, and that whereat they used to scoff will surround them.

Text1: And they say: Be Jews or Christians, then ye will be rightly guided. Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Nay, but (we follow) the religion of Abraham, the upright, and he was not of the idolaters.
Text2: And the family of Pharaoh took him up, that he might become for them an enemy and a sorrow, Lo! Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts were ever sinning.

Text1: Then will they have no contention save that they will say: By Allah, our Lord, we never were idolaters.
Text2: And the fish swallowed him while he was blameworthy;

Text1: For him are angels ranged before him and behind him, who guard him by Allah_s command. Lo! Allah changeth not the condition of a folk until they (first) change that which is in their hearts; and if Allah willeth misfortune for a folk there is none that can repel it, nor have they a defender beside Him.
Text2: And the folk of Noah aforetime, Lo! they were more unjust and more rebellious;

Text1: Verily in Joseph and his brethren are signs (of Allah_s Sovereignty) for the inquiring.
Text2: And the folk of Noah aforetime. Lo! they were licentious folk.

Text1: And keep your duty to Allah, and shame me not!
Text2: And the foremost in the race, the foremost in the race:

Text1: And when he saw their hands reached not to it, he mistrusted them and conceived a fear of them. They said: Fear not! Lo! we are sent unto the folk of Lot.
Text2: And the Garden is brought nigh for those who kept from evil, no longer distant.

Text1: Once the wrong-doers have beheld the chastisement, neither will it be lightened for them nor will they be granted any respite.
Text2: and the guilty shall behold the Fire and know that they are bound to fall into it, and will find no escape from it.

Text1: They will then be told: "Call upon those for help whom you declared to be Our associates." They will then call upon them but they will not answer them. They will have observed the chastisement in front of them. Would that they were guided!
Text2: and the guilty shall behold the Fire and know that they are bound to fall into it, and will find no escape from it.

Text1: And if they believe in the like of that which ye believe, then are they rightly guided. But if they turn away, then are they in schism, and Allah will suffice thee (for defence) against them. He is the Hearer, the Knower.
Text2: And the heart of the mother of Moses became void, and she would have betrayed him if We had not fortified her heart, that she might be of the believers.

Text1: They will be awarded the high place forasmuch as they were steadfast, and they will meet therein with welcome and the ward of peace,
Text2: And the heaven and Him Who built it,

Text1: And those among the wandering Arabs who had an excuse came in order that permission might be granted them. And those who lied to Allah and His messenger sat at home. A painful doom will fall on those of them who disbelieve.
Text2: And the heaven and the earth wept not for them, nor were they reprieved.

Text1: Then We heard his prayer, and bestowed upon him John, and adjusted his wife (to bear a child) for him. Lo! they used to vie one with the other in good deeds, and they cried unto Us in longing and in fear, and were submissive unto Us.
Text2: And the heaven is opened and becometh as gates,

Text1: And we intended that their Lord should change him for them for one better in purity and nearer to mercy.
Text2: And the heaven will split asunder, for that day it will be frail.

Text1: When it seeth them from afar, they hear the crackling and the roar thereof.
Text2: And the heaven, how it is raised?

Text1: And David and Solomon, when they gave judgment concerning the field, when people_s sheep had strayed and browsed therein by night; and We were witnesses to their judgment.
Text2: And the high hills bulwarks?

Text1: And bring thee the Truth, and lo! we are truth-tellers.
Text2: And the hills are ground to powder

Text1: And she who was chaste, therefor We breathed into her (something) of Our Spirit and made her and her son a token for (all) peoples.
Text2: And the hills are set in motion and become as a mirage.

Text1: And make mention of Mary in the Scripture, when she had withdrawn from her people to a chamber looking East,
Text2: And the hills become as flakes of wool,

Text1: And when they are flung into a narrow place thereof, chained together, they pray for destruction there.
Text2: And the hills, how they are set up?

Text1: And they raced with one another to the door, and she tore his shirt from behind, and they met her lord and master at the door. She said: What shall be his reward, who wisheth evil to thy folk, save prison or a painful doom?
Text2: And the House frequented,

Text1: On the day when the earth will be changed to other than the earth, and the heavens (also will be changed) and they will come forth unto Allah, the One, the Almighty,
Text2: And the jinn did He create of smokeless fire.

Text1: Now they have denied (the Truth); but there will come unto them tidings of that whereat they used to scoff.
Text2: And the messenger of Allah said: It is the she-camel of Allah, so let her drink!

Text1: We call to witness the cry of the Messenger: _O Lord, these are a people not wont to believe!ù
Text2: And the Messenger will say, "O my Lord, my people had made this Quran the object of their ridicule."

Text1: That thou followedst me not? Hast thou then disobeyed my order?
Text2: And the moon is eclipsed

Text1: And those who will not witness vanity, but when they pass near senseless play, pass by with dignity.
Text2: And the moon when she followeth him,

Text1: And when she heard of their sly talk, she sent to them and prepared for them a cushioned couch (to lie on at the feast) and gave to every one of them a knife and said (to Joseph): Come out unto them! And when they saw him they exalted him and cut their hands, exclaiming: Allah Blameless! This is no a human being. This is not other than some gracious angel.
Text2: And the mountains move away with (awful) movement,

Text1: and the mountains will be set in motion and become a mirage.
Text2: and the mountains shall be like fluffs of carded wool in varying colours.

Text1: and the mountains will become like dyed tufts of wool,
Text2: and the mountains shall be like fluffs of carded wool in varying colours.

Text1: Bear in mind the Day when We shall set the mountains in motion and you will find the earth void and bare. On that Day We shall muster all men together, leaving none of them behind.
Text2: and the mountains shall be like fluffs of carded wool in varying colours.

Text1: Bear in mind the Day when We shall set the mountains in motion and you will find the earth void and bare. On that Day We shall muster all men together, leaving none of them behind.
Text2: and the mountains shall violently fly about.

Text1: You now see the mountains and consider them firmly fixed, but then they shall pass away even as clouds pass away. That will be the handiwork of Allah Who has created everything with perfect wisdom. He is well aware of what you do.
Text2: and the mountains shall violently fly about.

Text1: He said: And what knowledge have I of what they may have been doing (in the past)?
Text2: And the mountains will become as carded wool.

Text1: It is He Who causes the dawn to split forth, and has ordained the night for repose, and the sun and the moon for reckoning time. All this is determined by Allah the Almighty, the All-Knowing.
Text2: And the night is another Sign for them. We strip the day from it and they become plunged in darkness.

Text1: Surely your Lord is none other than Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth in six days, and then ascended His Throne; Who causes the night to cover the day and then the day swiftly pursues the night; Who created the sun and the moon and the stars making them all subservient to His command. Lo! His is the creation and His is the command. Blessed is Allah, the Lord of the universe.
Text2: And the night is another Sign for them. We strip the day from it and they become plunged in darkness.

Text1: We have made night and day as two signs. We made the sign of the night devoid of light, and made the sign of the day radiant that you may seek the bounty of your Lord and know the computation of years and numbers. Thus We have expounded everything in detail to keep everything distinct from the other.
Text2: And the night is another Sign for them. We strip the day from it and they become plunged in darkness.

Text1: Those who have earned the Garden on that day will be better in their home and happier in their place of noonday rest;
Text2: And the night when it departeth,

Text1: And who say: Our Lord! Vouchsafe us comfort of our wives and of our offspring, and make us patterns for (all) those who ward off (evil).
Text2: And the night when it enshroudeth him,

Text1: Then they debated one with another what they must do, and they kept their counsel secret.
Text2: And the night when it withdraweth

Text1: The people of Aykah also gave the lie to the Messengers.
Text2: and the people of Aykah, and the people of Tubba'. They all gave the lie to the Messengers. Thereafter My threat of chastisement against them was fulfilled.

Text1: And surely they disbelieved when they said: 'Christ, the son of Mary, is indeed God'; whereas Christ had said: 'Children of Israel! Serve Allah, Who is your Lord and my Lord.' Allah has forbidden Paradise to those who associate anything with Him in His divinity and their refuge shall be the Fire. No one will be able to help such wrong-doers.
Text2: And the people of the Fire will cry out to the people of Paradise: 'Pour out some water on us or throw at us something of what Allah has bestowed upon you.' They will reply: 'Allah has forbidden them to the deniers of the truth,

Text1: And We make (this Scripture) easy in thy tongue, (O Muhammad) only that thou mayst bear good tidings therewith unto those who ward off (evil), and warn therewith the froward folk.
Text2: And the places of worship are only for Allah, so pray not unto anyone along with Allah.

Text1: (Joseph) said: She it was who asked of me an evil act. And a witness of her own folk testified: If his shirt is torn from before, then she speaketh truth and he is of the liars.
Text2: And the roof exalted,

Text1: And if his shirt is torn from behind, then she hath lied and he is of the truthful.
Text2: And the sea kept filled,

Text1: That is because Allah, He is the Truth and because He quickeneth the dead, and because He is Able to do all things;
Text2: And the second followeth it,

Text1: When their brother Noah said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)?
Text2: And the secrets of the breasts are made known,

Text1: Then after them We brought forth other generations.
Text2: And the sepulchres are overturned,

Text1: My Lord! Make me to establish proper worship, and some of my posterity (also); our Lord! and accept my prayer.
Text2: And the sky He hath uplifted; and He hath set the measure,

Text1: Unto Allah belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth. And Allah is sufficient as Defender.
Text2: And the sun runneth on unto a resting-place for him. That is the measuring of the Mighty, the Wise.

Text1: to witness the benefits in store for them, and pronounce the name of Allah during the appointed days over the cattle that He has provided them. So eat of it and feed the distressed and the needy.
Text2: and the ten nights,

Text1: Lo! the hypocrites (will be) in the lowest deep of the Fire, and thou wilt find no helper for them;
Text2: And the trumpet is blown and lo! from the graves they hie unto their Lord,

Text1: Lo! your Lord is Allah Who created the heavens and the earth in six Days, then mounted He the Throne. He covereth the night with the day, which is in haste to follow it, and hath made the sun and the moon and the stars subservient by His command. His verily is all creation and commandment. Blessed be Allah, the Lord of the Worlds!
Text2: And the trumpet is blown, and all who are in the heavens and all who are in the earth swoon away, save him whom Allah willeth. Then it is blown a second time, and behold them standing waiting!

Text1: And such were A_ad. They denied the revelations of their Lord and flouted His messengers and followed the command of every froward potentate.
Text2: And the trumpet is blown. This is the threatened Day.

Text1: And when it is said unto them: Come unto that which Allah hath revealed and unto the messenger, thou seest the hypocrites turn from thee with aversion.
Text2: And the two seas are not alike: this, fresh, sweet, good to drink, this (other) bitter, salt. And from them both ye eat fresh meat and derive the ornament that ye wear. And thou seest the ship cleaving them with its prow that ye may seek of His bounty, and that haply ye may give thanks.

Text1: Yet they ascribe as partners unto Him the jinn, although He did create them, and impute falsely, without knowledge, sons and daughters unto Him. Glorified be He and High Exalted above (all) that they ascribe (unto Him).
Text2: And the unruly, every builder and diver (made We subservient),

Text1: Say (O Muslims): We believe in Allah and that which is revealed unto us and that which was revealed unto Abraham, and Ishmael, and Isaac, and Jacob, and the tribes, and that which Moses and Jesus received, and that which the prophets received from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and unto Him we have surrendered.
Text2: And the wife of Pharaoh said: (He will be) a consolation for me and for thee. Kill him not. Peradventure he may be of use to us, or we may choose him for a son. And they perceived not.

Text1: Lo! We have sent thee (O Muhammad) with the truth, a bringer of glad tidings and a warner. And thou wilt not be asked about the owners of hell-fire.
Text2: And the Word will be fulfilled concerning them because they have done wrong, and they will not speak.

Text1: (And it was part of His scheme) when Allah said: 'O Jesus! I will recall you and raise you up to Me and will purify you (of the company) of those who disbelieve, and will set your followers above the unbelievers till the Day of Resurrection. Then to Me you shall return, and I will judge between you regarding what you differed.
Text2: and their saying: 'We slew the Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary', the Messenger of Allah - whereas in fact they had neither slain him nor crucified him but the matter was made dubious to them - and those who differed about it too were in a state of doubt! They have no definite knowledge of it, but merely follow conjecture; and they surely slew him not,

Text1: And I have attached thee to Myself.
Text2: And then bestowed upon him ample means,

Text1: and those who recite the Exhortation;
Text2: and then cast (Allah's) remembrance (in people's hearts),

Text1: And when it is said unto them: believe as the people believe, they say: shall we believe as the foolish believe? are not they indeed the foolish? But they know not.
Text2: And then cometh that which they were promised,

Text1: And on the day We gather them together We shall say unto those who ascribed partners (unto Allah): Where are (now) those partners of your make-believe?
Text2: And then drew lots and was of those rejected;

Text1: Give me pieces of iron - till, when he had levelled up (the gap) between the cliffs, he said: Blow! - till, when he had made it a fire, he said: Bring me molten copper to pour thereon.
Text2: And then expose him to hell-fire

Text1: And (Gog and Magog) were not able to surmount, nor could they pierce (it).
Text2: And then insert him in a chain whereof the length is seventy cubits.

Text1: and no bosom friend will enquire about any of his bosom friends
Text2: And then no sooner the Trumpet is blown than there will remain no kinship among them that Day, nor will they ask one another.

Text1: the Day when a friend shall be of no avail to his friend nor shall they be helped,
Text2: And then no sooner the Trumpet is blown than there will remain no kinship among them that Day, nor will they ask one another.

Text1: Kaf. Ha. Ya. A_in. Sad.
Text2: And then severed his life-artery,

Text1: On that Day will man be apprised of his deeds, both the earlier and the later.
Text2: And then the Record of their deeds shall be placed before them and you will see the guilty full of fear for what it contains, and will say: "Woe to us! What a Record this is! It leaves nothing, big or small, but encompasses it." They will find their deeds confronting them. Your Lord wrongs no one.

Text1: Then think of the Day We shall summon every community with its leader. Those who are given their Record in their right hand shall read the Record of their deeds and shall not be wronged a whit.
Text2: And then the Record of their deeds shall be placed before them and you will see the guilty full of fear for what it contains, and will say: "Woe to us! What a Record this is! It leaves nothing, big or small, but encompasses it." They will find their deeds confronting them. Your Lord wrongs no one.

Text1: This is Our Record which bears witness against you with truth; We used to record all what you did.ù
Text2: And then the Record of their deeds shall be placed before them and you will see the guilty full of fear for what it contains, and will say: "Woe to us! What a Record this is! It leaves nothing, big or small, but encompasses it." They will find their deeds confronting them. Your Lord wrongs no one.

Text1: We shall set up just scales on the Day of Resurrection so that none will be wronged in the least. (We shall bring forth the acts of everyone), even if it be the weight of a grain of mustard seed. We shall suffice as Reckoners.
Text2: And then the Record of their deeds shall be placed before them and you will see the guilty full of fear for what it contains, and will say: "Woe to us! What a Record this is! It leaves nothing, big or small, but encompasses it." They will find their deeds confronting them. Your Lord wrongs no one.

Text1: We shall surely raise the dead to life and We record what they did and the traces of their deeds that they have left behind. We have encompassed that in a Clear Book.
Text2: And then the Record of their deeds shall be placed before them and you will see the guilty full of fear for what it contains, and will say: "Woe to us! What a Record this is! It leaves nothing, big or small, but encompasses it." They will find their deeds confronting them. Your Lord wrongs no one.

Text1: There is none in the heavens and the earth but cometh unto the Beneficent as a slave.
Text2: And there are among us some who have surrendered (to Allah) and there are among us some who are unjust. And whoso hath surrendered to Allah, such have taken the right path purposefully.

Text1: There is no good in much of their secret conferences save (in) him who enjoineth almsgiving and kindness and peace-making among the people. Whoso doeth that, seeking the good pleasure of Allah, We shall bestow on him a vast reward.
Text2: And there came from the uttermost part of the city a man running. He cried: O my people! Follow those who have been sent!

Text1: And he of the two who was released, and (now) at length remembered, said: I am going to announce unto you the interpretation, therefore send me forth.
Text2: And there go round, waiting on them menservants of their own, as they were hidden pearls.

Text1: And lo! thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.
Text2: And there is none comparable unto Him.

Text1: Many of the people of the Scripture long to make you disbelievers after your belief, through envy on their own account, after the truth hath become manifest unto them. Forgive and be indulgent (toward them) until Allah give command. Lo! Allah is Able to do all things.
Text2: And there is nothing hidden in the heaven or the earth but it is in a clear Record.

Text1: Believers! Neither desecrate the symbols of (devotion to) Allah, nor the holy month, nor the animals of offering, nor the animals wearing collars indicating they are for sacrifice, nor ill-treat those who have set out for the Holy House seeking from their Lord His bounty and good pleasure. But once you are free from Pilgrimage obligations, you are free to hunt. Do not let your wrath against the people who have barred you from the Holy Mosque move you to commit undue transgressions; rather, help one another in acts of righteousness and piety, and do not help one another in sin and transgression. Fear Allah. Surely Allah is severe in retribution.
Text2: And there is nothing wrong if you also seek the bounty of your Lord during the pilgrimage. Moreover, when you return from 'Arafat, stay at Mash'aril-Haram (Muzdalifah) and remember Allah. And remember Him just as He has enjoined you, for you had gone astray before this.

Text1: to witness the benefits in store for them, and pronounce the name of Allah during the appointed days over the cattle that He has provided them. So eat of it and feed the distressed and the needy.
Text2: And there is nothing wrong if you also seek the bounty of your Lord during the pilgrimage. Moreover, when you return from 'Arafat, stay at Mash'aril-Haram (Muzdalifah) and remember Allah. And remember Him just as He has enjoined you, for you had gone astray before this.

Text1: And when We did appoint for Moses forty nights (of solitude), and then ye chose the calf, when he had gone from you, and were wrong-doers.
Text2: And there were gathered together unto Solomon his armies of the jinn and humankind, and of the birds, and they were set in battle order;

Text1: And those who believe and do good works: such are rightful owners of the Garden. They will abide therein.
Text2: And there were in the city nine persons who made mischief in the land and reformed not.

Text1: If you take retribution, then do so in proportion to the wrong done to you. But if you can bear such conduct with patience, indeed that is best for the steadfast.
Text2: And therein We had ordained for them: 'A life for a life, and an eye for an eye, and a nose for a nose, and an ear for an ear, and a tooth for a tooth, and for all wounds, like for like. But whosoever forgoes it by way of charity, it will be for him an expiation. Those who do not judge by what Allah has revealed are indeed the wrong-doers.

Text1: O Believers, the lawn of retribution has been prescribed for you in cases of murder; if a free man commits a murder, the free man shall he punished for it and a slave for a slave: likewise if a woman is guilty of murder the same shall he accountable for it. But in case the injured brother is willing to show leniency to the murderer, the blood money should he decided in accordance with the common law and the murderer should pay it in a genuine way. This is an allowance and mercy from your Lord. Now there shall be a painful torment for anyone who transgresses the limits after this. O men of understanding.
Text2: And therein We had ordained for them: 'A life for a life, and an eye for an eye, and a nose for a nose, and an ear for an ear, and a tooth for a tooth, and for all wounds, like for like. But whosoever forgoes it by way of charity, it will be for him an expiation. Those who do not judge by what Allah has revealed are indeed the wrong-doers.

Text1: The recompense of evil is evil the like of it. But he who forgives and makes amends, his reward lies with Allah. Surely He does not love the wrong-doers.
Text2: And therein We had ordained for them: 'A life for a life, and an eye for an eye, and a nose for a nose, and an ear for an ear, and a tooth for a tooth, and for all wounds, like for like. But whosoever forgoes it by way of charity, it will be for him an expiation. Those who do not judge by what Allah has revealed are indeed the wrong-doers.

Text1: And He it is Who hath constrained the sea to be of service that ye eat fresh meat from thence, and bring forth from thence ornaments which ye wear. And thou seest the ships ploughing it that ye (mankind) may seek of His bounty and that haply ye may give thanks.
Text2: And thereon ye will drink of boiling water,

Text1: And if they would deceive thee, then lo! Allah is Sufficient for thee. He it is Who supporteth thee with His help and with the believers,
Text2: And they allot to Him a portion of His bondmen! Lo! man is verily a mere ingrate.

Text1: And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Delight,
Text2: And they are ordered naught else than to serve Allah, keeping religion pure for Him, as men by nature upright, and to establish worship and to pay the poor-due. That is true religion.

Text1: (vi) and do not even draw near to the property of the orphan in his minority except in the best manner; (vii) and give full measures and weight with justice; We do not burden anyone beyond his capacity; (viii) When you speak, be just, even though it concern a near of kin; (ix) and fulfil the covenant of Allah. That is what He has enjoined upon you so that you may take heed.
Text2: And they ask "What ought we to spend (in the way of Allah)"? Say "Spend whatever you can spare." Thus Allah makes His commands clear to you so that you may think about the good of both this world and the Hereafter. They ask you about the right way of dealing with orphans. Say "The right way is that which is for their good." Then there is no harm if you live a common life with them for they are after all your own brethren. Allah knows well the one who means harm and also the one who means good. If Allah had willed He would have been hard upon you in this matter for He is All-Powerful but He is at the same time AlI-Wise.

Text1: And they say: There is naught save our life of the world, and we shall not be raised (again).
Text2: And they believed, therefor We gave them comfort for a while.

Text1: and are carried on them and also on ships.
Text2: and they carry your loads to many a place which you would be unable to reach without much hardship. Surely your Lord is Intensely Loving, Most Merciful.

Text1: And he had fruit. And he said unto his comrade, when he spake with him: I am more than thee in wealth, and stronger in respect of men.
Text2: And they cried out one unto another in the morning,

Text1: When ye are greeted with a greeting, greet ye with a better than it or return it. Lo! Allah taketh count of all things.
Text2: And they cry for help there, (saying): Our Lord! Release us; we will do right, not (the wrong) that we used to do. Did not We grant you a life long enough for him who reflected to reflect therein? And the warner came unto you. Now taste (the flavour of your deeds), for evil-doers have no helper.

Text1: Of them is he who saith: Grant me leave (to stay at home) and tempt me not. Surely it is into temptation that they (thus) have fallen. Lo! hell verily is all around the disbelievers.
Text2: And they cry: O master! Let thy Lord make an end of us. He saith: Lo! here ye must remain.

Text1: And guard yourselves against a day when no soul will in aught avail another, nor will intercession be accepted from it, nor will compensation be received from it, nor will they be helped.
Text2: And they denied them, though their souls acknowledged them, for spite and arrogance. Then see the nature of the consequence for the wrong-doers!

Text1: The duty of the messenger is only to convey (the message). Allah knoweth what ye proclaim and what ye hide.
Text2: And they designed a snare for him, but We made them the undermost.

Text1: He said: Did I not tell thee that thou couldst not bear with me?
Text2: And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, therefor did He grip them with a tightening grip.

Text1: Await they aught save the fulfilment thereof? On the day when the fulfilment thereof cometh, those who were before forgetful thereof will say: The messengers of our Lord did bring the Truth! Have we any intercessors, that they may intercede for us? Or can we be returned (to life on earth), that we may act otherwise than we used to act? They have lost their souls, and that which they devised hath failed them.
Text2: And they esteem not Allah as He hath the right to be esteemed, when the whole earth is His handful on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens are rolled in His right hand. Glorified is He and High Exalted from all that they ascribe as partner (unto Him).

Text1: And of them is he who made a covenant with Allah (saying): If He give us of His bounty we will give alms and become of the righteous.
Text2: And they had turned away from him and said: One taught (by others), a madman?

Text1: Say: As for him who is in error, the Beneficent will verily prolong his span of life until, when they behold that which they were promised, whether it be punishment (in the world), or the Hour (of doom), they will know who is worse in position and who is weaker as an army.
Text2: And they have led many astray, and Thou increasest the wrong-doers in naught save error.

Text1: He said: I shall ask forgiveness for you of my Lord. Lo! He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.
Text2: And they have no knowledge thereof. They follow but a guess, and lo! a guess can never take the place of the truth.

Text1: And when Our clear revelations are recited unto them, those who disbelieve say unto those who believe: Which of the two parties (yours or ours) is better in position, and more imposing as an army?
Text2: And they have plotted a mighty plot,

Text1: How many a generation have We destroyed before them, who were more imposing in respect of gear and outward seeming!
Text2: And they have said: Forsake not your gods. Forsake not Wadd, nor Suwa_, nor Yaghuth and Ya_uq and Nasr.

Text1: Lo! those who disbelieve and deal in wrong, Allah will never forgive them, neither will He guide them unto a road,
Text2: And they have taken (other) gods beside Allah, in order that they may be helped.

Text1: Those who deny Our revelations are deaf and dumb in darkness. Whom Allah will sendeth astray, and whom He will He placeth on a straight path.
Text2: And they imagine kinship between him and the jinn, whereas the jinn know well that they will be brought before (Him).

Text1: Now hath Allah lightened your burden, for He knoweth that there is weakness in you. So if there be of you a steadfast hundred they shall overcome two hundred, and if there be of you a thousand (steadfast) they shall overcome two thousand by permission of Allah. Allah is with the steadfast.
Text2: And they make the angels, who are the slaves of the Beneficent, females. Did they witness their creation? Their testimony will be recorded and they will be questioned.

Text1: For every announcement there is a term, and ye will come to know.
Text2: And they marvel that a warner from among themselves hath come unto them, and the disbelievers say: This is a wizard, a charlatan.

Text1: Their Lord giveth them good tidings of mercy from Him, and acceptance, and Gardens where enduring pleasure will be theirs;
Text2: And they said: O wizard! Entreat thy Lord for us by the pact that He hath made with thee. Lo! we verily will walk aright.

Text1: And (remember) when thy Lord proclaimed that He would raise against them till the Day of Resurrection those who would lay on them a cruel torment. Lo! verily thy Lord is swift in prosecution and lo! verily He is Forgiving, Merciful.
Text2: And they say unto their skins: Why testify ye against us? They say: Allah hath given us speech Who giveth speech to all things, and Who created you at the first, and unto Whom ye are returned.

Text1: And among us there are righteous folk and among us there are far from that. We are sects having different rules.
Text2: And they say: Had we been wont to listen or have sense, we had not been among the dwellers in the flames.

Text1: And We said unto the Children of Israel after him: Dwell in the land; but when the promise of the Hereafter cometh to pass We shall bring you as a crowd gathered out of various nations.
Text2: And they say: Had we been wont to listen or have sense, we had not been among the dwellers in the flames.

Text1: And a proclamation from Allah and His messenger to all men on the day of the Greater Pilgrimage that Allah is free from obligation to the idolaters, and (so is) His messenger. So, if ye repent, it will be better for you; but if ye are averse, then know that ye cannot escape Allah. Give tidings (O Muhammad) of a painful doom to those who disbelieve,
Text2: And they say: If only this Quran had been revealed to some great man of the two towns?

Text1: It is not for any prophet to have captives until he hath made slaughter in the land. Ye desire the lure of this world and Allah desireth (for you) the Hereafter, and Allah is Mighty, Wise.
Text2: And they say: If the Beneficent One had (so) willed, we should not have worshipped them. They have no knowledge whatsoever of that. They do but guess.

Text1: (Fast) a certain number of days; and (for) him who is sick among you, or on a journey, (the same) number of other days; and for those who can afford it there is a ransom: the feeding of a man in need - but whoso doeth good of his own accord, it is better for him: and that ye fast is better for you if ye did but know -
Text2: And they say: If we were to follow the Guidance with thee we should be torn out of our land. Have We not established for them a sure sanctuary, whereunto the produce of all things is brought (in trade), a provision from Our presence? But most of them know not.

Text1: Whereby Allah guideth him who seeketh His good pleasure unto paths of peace. He bringeth them out of darkness unto light by His decree, and guideth them unto a straight path.
Text2: And they say: Lo! this is mere magic;

Text1: He said: My Lord! Have mercy on me and on my brother; bring us into Thy mercy, Thou the Most Merciful of all who show mercy.
Text2: And they say: Our hearts are protected from that unto which thou (O Muhammad) callest us, and in our ears there is a deafness, and between us and thee there is a veil. Act, then. Lo! we also shall be acting.

Text1: Unto Allah belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. Allah is Able to do all things.
Text2: And they say: Our Lord! Lo! we obeyed our princes and great men, and they misled us from the Way.

Text1: And if any tidings, whether of safety or fear, come unto them, they noise it abroad, whereas if they had referred it to the messenger and to such of them as are in authority, those among them who are able to think out the matter would have known it. If it had not been for the grace of Allah upon you and His mercy ye would have followed Satan, save a few (of you).
Text2: And they say: Praise be to Allah Who hath put grief away from us. Lo! Our Lord is Forgiving, Bountiful,

Text1: And when Our clear revelations are recited unto them, they who look not for the meeting with Us say: Bring a Lecture other than this, or change it. Say (O Muhammad): It is not for me to change it of my accord. I only follow that which is inspired in me. Lo! if I disobey my Lord I fear the retribution of an awful Day.
Text2: And they say: There is naught but our life of the world; we die and we live, and naught destroyeth us save time; when they have no knowledge whatsoever of (all) that; they do but guess.

Text1: Whoso doeth that through aggression and injustice, we shall cast him into Fire, and that is ever easy for Allah.
Text2: And they say: We are more (than you) in wealth and children. We are not the punished!

Text1: And whomsoever it is Allah_s will to guide, He expandeth his bosom unto the Surrender, and whomsoever it is His Will to send astray, He maketh his bosom close and narrow as if he were engaged in sheer ascent. Thus Allah layeth ignominy upon those who believe not.
Text2: And they say: What aileth us that we behold not men whom we were wont to count among the wicked?

Text1: And lo! We shall make all that is thereon a barren mound.
Text2: And they say: When (will) this promise (be fulfilled), if ye are truthful?

Text1: Neither those who disbelieve among the people of the Scripture nor the idolaters love that there should be sent down unto you any good thing from your Lord. But Allah chooseth for His mercy whom He will, and Allah is of Infinite Bounty.
Text2: And they say: When (will) this promise (be fulfilled), if ye are truthful?

Text1: If a lucky chance befall you, it is evil unto them, and if disaster strike you they rejoice thereat. But if ye persevere and keep from evil their guile will never harm you. Lo! Allah is Surrounding what they do.
Text2: And they say: When cometh this victory (of yours) if ye are truthful?

Text1: And all married women (are forbidden unto you) save those (captives) whom your right hands possess. It is a decree of Allah for you. Lawful unto you are all beyond those mentioned, so that ye seek them with your wealth in honest wedlock, not debauchery. And those of whom ye seek content (by marrying them), give unto them their portions as a duty. And there is no sin for you in what ye do by mutual agreement after the duty (hath been done). Lo! Allah is ever Knower, Wise.
