Text2: Those who gave the lie to Our signs are deaf and dumb and blunder about in darkness. Allah causes whomsoever He wills to stray in error, and sets whomsoever He wills on the straight way.'

Text1: Then all of them will appear exposed before Allah, and the weak ones will say to the haughty ones: "We merely followed you. Will you, then, protect us from Allah's chastisement?" They will say: "Had Allah shown us the Way to our salvation, we would surely have also guided you. Now it is all the same whether we cry or suffer patiently, we have no escape."
Text2: Those who had waxed proud will reply: _All of us are in it. Allah has already passed His judgement among His servants.ù

Text1: They will then turn towards each other (and start wrangling).
Text2: Those who had waxed proud will reply: _All of us are in it. Allah has already passed His judgement among His servants.ù

Text1: O mankind! Be careful of your duty to your Lord Who created you from a single soul and from it created its mate and from them twain hath spread abroad a multitude of men and women. Be careful of your duty toward Allah in Whom ye claim (your rights) of one another, and toward the wombs (that bare you). Lo! Allah hath been a watcher over you.
Text2: Those who have been given knowledge see that what is revealed unto thee from thy Lord is the truth and leadeth unto the path of the Mighty, the Owner of Praise.

Text1: This has been happening all along.
Text2: Those who have rejected the Message of the Prophet, say, "This (Al-Furgan) is a forgery which this man himself has devised, and some others have helped him at it. " What a cruel injustice and an impudent lie!

Text1: How woeful is the plight of him who has nothing except his face to shield him from severe chastisement on the Day of Resurrection? Such evil-doers shall be told: _Taste now the consequence of your deeds.ù
Text2: Those who pervert Our Signs are not hidden from Us. Is he who will be cast into the Fire better, or he who comes secure on the Day of Resurrection? Do as you wish; He sees all what you do.

Text1: Whosoever comes with good will receive a reward better than his deed, and they will be made secure from the terror of that Day.
Text2: Those who pervert Our Signs are not hidden from Us. Is he who will be cast into the Fire better, or he who comes secure on the Day of Resurrection? Do as you wish; He sees all what you do.

Text1: For those who disbelieve and debar (men) from the way of Allah, We add doom to doom because they wrought corruption,
Text2: Those who put away their wives (by saying they are as their mothers) and afterward would go back on that which they have said, (the penalty) in that case (is) the freeing of a slave before they touch one another. Unto this ye are exhorted; and Allah is Informed of what ye do.

Text1: We have sent you with the Truth to proclaim good news and to warn. Never has there been a nation but a warner came to it.
Text2: Those who refused to believe in you say: "Why has no (miraculous) sign been sent down upon him from his Lord?" You are only a warner, and every people has its guide.

Text1: (If they want a sign for the perception of this Reality) surety there are countless signs for those who use their common sense; they can see alternation of the night and day, in the ships that sail the ocean laden with cargoes beneficial to mankind, and in the rain-water which Allah sends down from the sky and thereby gives life to the earth after its death and spreads over it all kinds of animate creatures, in the blowing of the winds and in the clouds which obediently wait for orders between the sky and the earth.
Text2: those who remember Allah while standing, sitting or (reclining) on their backs, and reflect in the creation of the heavens and the earth, (saying): 'Our Lord! You have not created this in vain. Glory to You! Save us, then, from the chastisement of the Fire.

Text1: People of the Book! Do not exceed the limits in your religion, and attribute to Allah nothing except the truth. The Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary, was only a Messenger of Allah, and His command that He conveyed unto Mary, and a spirit from Him (which led to Mary's conception). So believe in Allah and in His Messengers, and do not say: (Allah is a) trinity. Give up this assertion; it would be better for you. Allah is indeed just one God. Far be it from His glory that He should have a son. To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and in the earth. Allah is sufficient for a guardian.
Text2: Those who said: 'Allah is one of the Three', certainly they disbelieved, for there is no god save the One God. And if they do not give up this claim, all who have disbelieved among them shall be subjected to painful chastisement.

Text1: For them are glad tidings in this world and in the Hereafter. The words of Allah shall not change. That is the supreme triumph.
Text2: Those who say _Allah is our Lordù and then remain steadfast, upon them descend angels (and say): _Do not fear nor grieve, and receive good tidings of Paradise which you were promised.

Text1: Rest assured that whosoever from among the Muslims or the Jews or the Christians or the Sabaeans believes in Allah and the Last Day, and performs good deeds, he will have his reward with his Lord and he will have no cause for fear and grief.
Text2: Those who say _Allah is our Lordù and then remain steadfast, upon them descend angels (and say): _Do not fear nor grieve, and receive good tidings of Paradise which you were promised.

Text1: The Day, when they will see the angels, will not be a day of rejoicing for the criminals; they will cry out, "May Allah save us!"
Text2: Those who say _Allah is our Lordù and then remain steadfast, upon them descend angels (and say): _Do not fear nor grieve, and receive good tidings of Paradise which you were promised.

Text1: those whose souls the angels seize while they are in a state of purity, saying: "Peace be upon you. Enter Paradise as a reward for your deeds."
Text2: Those who say _Allah is our Lordù and then remain steadfast, upon them descend angels (and say): _Do not fear nor grieve, and receive good tidings of Paradise which you were promised.

Text1: He who desires the reward of this world, let him know that with Allah is the reward of this world and also of the World to Come. Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.
Text2: Those who seek merely the present world and its adornment. We fully recompense them for their work in this world, and they are made to suffer no diminution in it concerning what is their due.

Text1: who spend in the way of Allah both in plenty and hardship, who restrain their anger, and forgive others. Allah loves such good-doers."
Text2: Those who spend their wealth secretly and openly by day and night, will have their reward with their Lord, and they have nothing to fear nor grieve.

Text1: Has it not, then, become plain to those who have inherited the earth in the wake of the former generations that, had We so willed, We could have afflicted them for their sins, (they, however, are heedless to basic facts and so) We seal their hearts so that they hear nothing.
Text2: Those who went before them also denounced (Allah's Messengers) as liars. They have not attained even a tenth of what We had given them. But when they rejected My Messengers, calling them liars, how terrible was My chastisement!

Text1: Allah would make the burden light for you, for man was created weak.
Text2: Those who were despised say unto those who were proud: Nay but (it was your) scheming night and day, when ye commanded us to disbelieve in Allah and set up rivals unto Him. And they are filled with remorse when they behold the doom; and We place carcans on the necks of those who disbelieved. Are they requited aught save what they used to do?

Text1: And He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in six Days - and His Throne was upon the water - that He might try you, which of you is best in conduct. Yet if thou (O Muhammad) sayest: Lo! ye will be raised again after death! those who disbelieve will surely say: This is naught but mere magic.
Text2: Those who were left behind will say, when ye set forth to capture booty: Let us go with you. They fain would change the verdict of Allah. Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Ye shall not go with us. Thus hath Allah said beforehand. Then they will say: Ye are envious of us. Nay, but they understand not, save a little.

Text1: And Allah would turn to you in mercy; but those who follow vain desires would have you go tremendously astray.
Text2: Those who were proud say unto those who were despised: Did we drive you away from the guidance after it had come unto you? Nay, but ye were guilty.

Text1: The chiefs of Pharaoh_s people said: Lo! this is some knowing wizard,
Text2: Those who were proud say: Lo! we are all (together) herein. Lo! Allah hath judged between (His) slaves.

Text1: Surely many people before them had plotted in a similar manner to (vanquish the Truth), but Allah uprooted the whole structure of their plot from its foundations so that the roof fell in upon them, and the chastisement (of Allah) visited them from unknown directions.
Text2: Those who were suppressed will say to those who waxed arrogant: _By no means; it was your scheming, night and day, when you would enjoin us to disbelieve in Allah and set up others as equals to Him.ù When they are confronted with the chastisement, they will be remorseful in their hearts. We shall put fetters around the necks of the unbelievers. Can people be requited except for their deeds?

Text1: Then all of them will appear exposed before Allah, and the weak ones will say to the haughty ones: "We merely followed you. Will you, then, protect us from Allah's chastisement?" They will say: "Had Allah shown us the Way to our salvation, we would surely have also guided you. Now it is all the same whether we cry or suffer patiently, we have no escape."
Text2: Those who were suppressed will say to those who waxed arrogant: _By no means; it was your scheming, night and day, when you would enjoin us to disbelieve in Allah and set up others as equals to Him.ù When they are confronted with the chastisement, they will be remorseful in their hearts. We shall put fetters around the necks of the unbelievers. Can people be requited except for their deeds?

Text1: Then the preceding ones will say to the succeeding ones: 'You were in no way superior to us; taste, then, this torment for your deeds.'
Text2: Those who were suppressed will say to those who waxed arrogant: _By no means; it was your scheming, night and day, when you would enjoin us to disbelieve in Allah and set up others as equals to Him.ù When they are confronted with the chastisement, they will be remorseful in their hearts. We shall put fetters around the necks of the unbelievers. Can people be requited except for their deeds?

Text1: They contrived a plot of great magnitude.
Text2: Those who were suppressed will say to those who waxed arrogant: _By no means; it was your scheming, night and day, when you would enjoin us to disbelieve in Allah and set up others as equals to Him.ù When they are confronted with the chastisement, they will be remorseful in their hearts. We shall put fetters around the necks of the unbelievers. Can people be requited except for their deeds?

Text1: They will then turn towards each other (and start wrangling).
Text2: Those who were suppressed will say to those who waxed arrogant: _By no means; it was your scheming, night and day, when you would enjoin us to disbelieve in Allah and set up others as equals to Him.ù When they are confronted with the chastisement, they will be remorseful in their hearts. We shall put fetters around the necks of the unbelievers. Can people be requited except for their deeds?

Text1: Thus We have appointed the leaders of the wicked ones in every land to weave their plots; but in truth they plot only to their own harm, without even realizing it.
Text2: Those who were suppressed will say to those who waxed arrogant: _By no means; it was your scheming, night and day, when you would enjoin us to disbelieve in Allah and set up others as equals to Him.ù When they are confronted with the chastisement, they will be remorseful in their hearts. We shall put fetters around the necks of the unbelievers. Can people be requited except for their deeds?

Text1: When He will inflict punishment, those very leaders and guides whom they followed in the world will disown them. But punishment they shall get and all their bonds shall be cut off.
Text2: Those who were suppressed will say to those who waxed arrogant: _By no means; it was your scheming, night and day, when you would enjoin us to disbelieve in Allah and set up others as equals to Him.ù When they are confronted with the chastisement, they will be remorseful in their hearts. We shall put fetters around the necks of the unbelievers. Can people be requited except for their deeds?

Text1: Believers, if you have left (your homes and) have come forth to struggle in My Way and to seek My good pleasure, do not make friends with My enemies and your enemies. You befriend them whereas they have spurned the Truth that has come to you; and (such is their enmity that) they expel the Messenger and yourselves for no other reason than that you believe in Allah, your Lord. You send to them messages of friendship in secrecy, although I know well whatever you do, be it secretly or publicly. And whosoever of you does so has indeed strayed far away from the Straight Path.
Text2: those who were unjustly expelled from their homes for no other reason than their saying: "Allah is Our Lord." If Allah were not to repel some through others, monasteries and churches and synagogues and mosques wherein the name of Allah is much mentioned, would certainly have been pulled down. Allah will most certainly help those who will help Him. Verily Allah is Immensely Strong, Overwhelmingly Mighty.

Text1: And those who ascribe not partners unto their Lord,
Text2: Those who when they take the measure from mankind demand it full,

Text1: And if the people of the townships had believed and kept from evil, surely We should have opened for them blessings from the sky and from the earth. But (unto every messenger) they gave the lie, and so We seized them on account of what they used to earn.
Text2: Those who wrangle concerning the revelations of Allah without any warrant that hath come unto them, it is greatly hateful in the sight of Allah and in the sight of those who believe. Thus doth Allah print on every arrogant, disdainful heart.

Text1: It is no virtue. That you turn your faces towards the east or the west, but virtue is that one should sincerely believe in Allah and the Last Day and the Angels and the Book and the Prophets and, out of His love, spend of one's choice wealth for relatives and orphans, for the needy and the wayfarer, for beggars and for the ransom of slaves, and establish the Salat and pay the Zakat. And the virtuous are those who keep their pledges when they make them and show fortitude in hardships and adversity and in the struggle between the Truth and falsehood; such are the truthful people and such are the pious.
Text2: those who, for the love of Him, feed the needy, and the orphan, and the captive,

Text1: and are constant in their Prayer;
Text2: those who, in their Prayers, humble themselves;

Text1: (vi) and do not even draw near to the property of the orphan in his minority except in the best manner; (vii) and give full measures and weight with justice; We do not burden anyone beyond his capacity; (viii) When you speak, be just, even though it concern a near of kin; (ix) and fulfil the covenant of Allah. That is what He has enjoined upon you so that you may take heed.
Text2: those who, when they take from others by measure, take their full share;

Text1: Believers! Fear Allah and seek the means to come near to Him, and strive hard in His way; maybe you will attain true success.
Text2: Those whom they call upon are themselves seeking the means of access to their Lord, each trying to be nearer to Him. They crave for His Mercy and dread His chastisement. Surely your Lord's punishment is to be feared.

Text1: Thus, through a firm word, Allah grants firmness to the believers both in this world and in the Hereafter. As for the wrong-doers, Allah lets them go astray. Allah does whatever He wills.
Text2: those whose souls the angels seize while they are in a state of purity, saying: "Peace be upon you. Enter Paradise as a reward for your deeds."

Text1: (And) the dwellers in Midian. And Moses was denied; but I indulged the disbelievers a long while, then I seized them, and how (terrible) was My abhorrence!
Text2: Thou art but a warner unto him who feareth it.

Text1: Therein abiding, they have all that they desire. It is for thy Lord a promise that must be fulfilled.
Text2: Thou art not at all a warder over them.

Text1: These, our people, have chosen (other) gods beside Him though they bring no clear warrant (vouchsafed) to them. And who doth greater wrong than he who inventeth a lie concerning Allah?
Text2: Thou art not, for thy Lord_s favour unto thee, a madman.

Text1: Those unto whom men said: Lo! the people have gathered against you, therefor fear them. (The threat of danger) but increased the faith of them and they cried: Allah is Sufficient for us! Most Excellent is He in Whom we trust!
Text2: Thou canst defer whom thou wilt of them and receive unto thee whom thou wilt, and whomsoever thou desirest of those whom thou hast set aside (temporarily), it is no sin for thee (to receive her again); that is better; that they may be comforted and not grieve, and may all be pleased with what thou givest them. Allah knoweth what is in your hearts (O men), and Allah is ever Forgiving, Clement.

Text1: Mankind were one community, and Allah sent (unto them) prophets as bearers of good tidings and as warners, and revealed therewith the Scripture with the truth that it might judge between mankind concerning that wherein they differed. And only those unto whom (the Scripture) was given differed concerning it, after clear proofs had come unto them, through hatred one of another. And Allah by His Will guided those who believe unto the truth of that concerning which they differed. Allah guideth whom He will unto a straight path.
Text2: Thou hadst no hope that the Scripture would be inspired in thee; but it is a mercy from thy Lord, so never be a helper to the disbelievers.

Text1: O ye who believe! Let there be witnesses between you when death draweth nigh unto one of you, at the time of bequest - two witnesses, just men from among you, or two others from another tribe, in case ye are campaigning in the land and the calamity of death befall you. Ye shall empanel them both after the prayer, and, if ye doubt, they shall be made to swear by Allah (saying): We will not take a bribe, even though it were (on behalf of) a near kinsman nor will we hide the testimony of Allah, for then indeed we should be of the sinful.
Text2: Thou hast already fulfilled the vision. Lo! thus do We reward the good.

Text1: Whoso on that day turneth his back to them, unless manoeuvring for battle or intent to join a company, he truly hath incurred wrath from Allah, and his habitation will be hell, a hapless journey_s end.
Text2: Thou seest the wrong-doers fearful of that which they have earned, and it will surely befall them, while those who believe and do good works (will be) in flowering meadows of the Gardens, having what they wish from their Lord. This is the great preferment.

Text1: Lo! We reveal unto thee the Scripture with the truth, that thou mayst judge between mankind by that which Allah showeth thee. And be not thou a pleader for the treacherous;
Text2: Thou warnest only him who followeth the Reminder and feareth the Beneficent in secret. To him bear tidings of forgiveness and a rich reward.

Text1: Nay, but they say the like of that which said the men of old;
Text2: Thou wilt know in their faces the radiance of delight.

Text1: He knoweth (all) that is before them and (all) that is behind them, while they cannot compass it in knowledge.
Text2: Thou wilt know that some great disaster is about to fall on them.

Text1: That is because they have chosen the life of the world rather than the Hereafter, and because Allah guideth not the disbelieving folk.
Text2: Thou wilt not find folk who believe in Allah and the Last Day loving those who oppose Allah and His messenger, even though they be their fathers or their sons or their brethren or their clan. As for such, He hath written faith upon their hearts and hath strengthened them with a Spirit from Him, and He will bring them into Gardens underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide. Allah is well pleased with them, and they are well pleased with Him. They are Allah_s party. Lo! is it not Allah_s party who are the successful?

Text1: Until, when death cometh unto one of them, he saith: My Lord! Send me back,
Text2: Thou, verily, O man, art working toward thy Lord a work which thou wilt meet (in His presence).

Text1: She said: My Lord! How can I have a child when no mortal hath touched me? He said: So (it will be). Allah createth what He will. If He decreeth a thing, He saith unto it only: Be! and it is.
Text2: Though before that, even before it was sent down upon them, they were in despair.

Text1: She said: Lo! I seek refuge in the Beneficent One from thee, if thou art Allah-fearing.
Text2: Though they will be given sight of them. The guilty man will long to be able to ransom himself from the punishment of that day at the price of his children

Text1: So We sent against them the flood and the locusts and the vermin and the frogs and the blood - a succession of clear signs. But they were arrogant and became a guilty folk.
Text2: Through boiling waters; then they are thrust into the Fire.

Text1: Lo! (the mountains) As-Safa and Al-Marwah are among the indications of Allah. It is therefore no sin for him who is on pilgrimage to the House (of Allah) or visiteth it, to go around them (as the pagan custom is). And he who doeth good of his own accord, (for him) lo! Allah is Responsive, Aware.
Text2: Throw down thy staff. And when he saw it writhing as it had been a demon, he turned to flee headlong, (and it was said unto him): O Moses! Draw nigh and fear not. Lo! thou art of those who are secure.

Text1: Lo! Those who hide the proofs and the guidance which We revealed, after We had made it clear to mankind in the Scripture: such are accursed of Allah and accursed of those who have the power to curse.
Text2: Thrust thy hand into the bosom of thy robe it will come forth white without hurt. And guard thy heart from fear. Then these shall be two proofs from your Lord unto Pharaoh and his chiefs. Lo! they are evil-living folk.

Text1: He said: What hindered thee that thou didst not fall prostrate when I bade thee? (Iblis) said: I am better than him. Thou createdst me of fire while him Thou didst create of mud.
Text2: Thus Allah made them taste humiliation in the life of the world, and verily the doom of the Hereafter will be greater if they did but know.

Text1: And when thou bringest not a verse for them they say: Why hast thou not chosen it? Say: I follow only that which is inspired in me from my Lord. This (Quran) is insight from your Lord, and a guidance and a mercy for a people that believe.
Text2: Thus Allah the Mighty, the Knower inspireth thee (Muhammad) as (He inspired) those before thee.

Text1: Surely I shall have your hands and feet cut off upon alternate sides. Then I shall crucify you every one.
Text2: Thus are they perverted who deny the revelations of Allah.

Text1: If those who disbelieved but knew the time when they will not be able to drive off the fire from their faces and from their backs, and they will not be helped!
Text2: Thus deal We ever with the guilty.

Text1: Allah hath sealed their hearing and their hearts, and on their eyes there is a covering. Theirs will be an awful doom.
Text2: Thus do We make it traverse the hearts of the guilty.

Text1: And they were utterly confounded, and they said: Well thou knowest that these speak not.
Text2: Thus do We reward the good.

Text1: And when I inspired the disciples, (saying): Believe in Me and in My messenger, they said: We believe. Bear witness that we have surrendered (unto Thee) "we are muslims".
Text2: Thus do We reward the good.

Text1: And as for those who believe and do good works, He will pay them their wages in full. Allah loveth not wrong-doers.
Text2: Thus doth Allah seal the hearts of those who know not.

Text1: And thus it is: whenever We sent any warner to a city its affluent ones said: _We found our forefathers on a way and we continue to follow in their footsteps.ù
Text2: Thus has it been (in the past): never did a Messenger come to the nations that preceded them but they said: _(He is) a sorcerer, or a mad-man.ù

Text1: O Prophet, We have sent you forth as a witness, a bearer of good tidings, and a warner,
Text2: Thus have We made you a Community of the "Golden Mean" so that you may be witnesses in regard to mankind and the Messenger may be a witness in regard to you. We had appointed the former giblah towards which you used to turn your face merely to test who would follow the Messenger and who would turn back. It was indeed a hard test but not for those who had been blessed with Guidance from Allah. Allah will not let go to waste this faith of yours; rest assured that He is full of pity and mercy for mankind.

Text1: Strive in the cause of Allah in a manner worthy of that striving. He has chosen you (for His task), and He has not laid upon you any hardship in religion. Keep to the faith of your father Abraham. Allah named you Muslims earlier and even in this (Book), that the Messenger may be a witness over you, and that you may be witnesses over all mankind. So establish Prayer, and pay Zakah, and hold fast to Allah. He is your Protector. What an excellent Protector; what an excellent Helper!
Text2: Thus have We made you a Community of the "Golden Mean" so that you may be witnesses in regard to mankind and the Messenger may be a witness in regard to you. We had appointed the former giblah towards which you used to turn your face merely to test who would follow the Messenger and who would turn back. It was indeed a hard test but not for those who had been blessed with Guidance from Allah. Allah will not let go to waste this faith of yours; rest assured that He is full of pity and mercy for mankind.

Text1: You are now the best people brought forth for (the guidance and reform of) mankind. You enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and believe in Allah. Had the People of the Book believed it were better for them. Some of them are believers but most of them are transgressors.
Text2: Thus have We made you a Community of the "Golden Mean" so that you may be witnesses in regard to mankind and the Messenger may be a witness in regard to you. We had appointed the former giblah towards which you used to turn your face merely to test who would follow the Messenger and who would turn back. It was indeed a hard test but not for those who had been blessed with Guidance from Allah. Allah will not let go to waste this faith of yours; rest assured that He is full of pity and mercy for mankind.

Text1: Then Allah sent His peace of reassurance down upon His messenger and upon the believers, and sent down hosts ye could not see, and punished those who disbelieved. Such is the reward of disbelievers.
Text2: Thus he persuaded his people to make light (of Moses), and they obeyed him. Lo! they were a wanton folk.

Text1: Have they not observed all things that Allah hath created, how their shadows incline to the right and to the left, making prostration unto Allah, and they are lowly?
Text2: Thus if he is of those brought nigh,

Text1: We bestowed the same favour upon Noah. Recall, when he cried to Us before; We accepted his prayer and delivered him and his household from the great distress
Text2: Thus it was until Our command came to pass and the oven boiled over. We said: 'Take into the Ark a pair of every species; and take your own family except those who have already been declared (as unworthy); and also take everyone who believes. But those who, along with him, had believed were indeed just a few.

Text1: And We made those who had been persecuted inherit the eastern and western lands which We had blessed. Thus your Lord's gracious promise was fulfilled to the Children of Israel, for they had endured with patience; and We destroyed all that Pharaoh and his people had wrought, and all that they had built.
Text2: Thus it was; and We made another people inherit all that.

Text1: But Satan seduced him, saying: "Adam! Shall I direct you to a tree of eternal life and an abiding kingdom?"
Text2: Thus Satan brought about their fall by deceit. And when they tasted of the tree, their shame became vislible to them, and both began to cover themselves with leaves from the Garden. Then their Lord called out to them: 'Did I not forbid you from that tree, and did I not warn you that Satan 'is your declared enemy?'

Text1: Those who lived before them also devised many a plot, but the master plot rests with Allah. He knows what everyone does. The deniers of the truth will soon come to know whose end is good.
Text2: Thus they planned and We too planned, the while they did not know.

Text1: Thereafter, Moses threw down his rod and behold, it went about swallowing up all the false devices they had contrived.
Text2: Thus was the truth established, and their doings proved in vain.

Text1: He said: O my people! There is no foolishness in me, but I am a messenger from the Lord of the Worlds.
Text2: Thus was the word of thy Lord concerning those who disbelieve fulfilled: That they are owners of the Fire.

Text1: Nay, but We gave these and their fathers ease until life grew long for them. See they not how we aim to the land, reducing it of its outlying parts? Can they then be the victors?
Text2: Thus We arranged. How excellent is Our arranging!

Text1: We never sent a warner to any town but its wealthy ones said: _We disbelieve in the Message you have brought.ù
Text2: Thus We have appointed the leaders of the wicked ones in every land to weave their plots; but in truth they plot only to their own harm, without even realizing it.

Text1: When We decide to destroy a town We command the affluent among them, whereupon they commit sins in it, then the decree (of chastisement) becomes due against them and thereafter We destroy that town utterly.
Text2: Thus We have appointed the leaders of the wicked ones in every land to weave their plots; but in truth they plot only to their own harm, without even realizing it.

Text1: And do not drive away those who invoke their Lord in the morning and the evening, seeking His pleasure all the time. You are by no means accountable for them just as they are by no means accountable for you. If you still drive them away, you will become among the wrong-doers.
Text2: Thus We have made some of them a means for testing others so that they should say: 'Are these theones among us upon whom Allah has bestowed His favour?' Yes, does Allah not know well who are the thankful?

Text1: When Our clear revelations are recited to those who deny the Truth they are wont to say to those who have faith: "Which of the two groups has a better status and whose assemblies are grander?"
Text2: Thus We have made some of them a means for testing others so that they should say: 'Are these theones among us upon whom Allah has bestowed His favour?' Yes, does Allah not know well who are the thankful?

Text1: The only reward of those who make war upon Allah and His messenger and strive after corruption in the land will be that they will be killed or crucified, or have their hands and feet on alternate sides cut off, or will be expelled out of the land. Such will be their degradation in the world, and in the Hereafter theirs will be an awful doom;
Text2: Thus we misled you. Lo! we were (ourselves) astray.

Text1: (After the judgement has been passed) the unbelievers shall be driven in companies to Hell so that when they arrive there, its gates shall be thrown open and its keepers shall say to them: _Did Messengers from among yourselves not come to you, rehearsing to you the Signs of your Lord and warning you against your meeting of this Day?ù They will say: _Yes indeed; but the sentence of chastisement was bound to be executed against the unbelievers.ù
Text2: Thus will they confess their sins. Damned are these inmates of the Blazing Fire.

Text1: (O Prophet), Did We not lay open your breast
Text2: Thus, (it is a fact that) whomsoever Allah wills to guide, He opens his breast for Islam; and whomsoever He wills to let go astray, He causes his breast to become strait and constricted, as if he were climbing towards the heaven. Thus Allah lays the abomination (of flight from and hatred of Islam) on those who do not believe

Text1: those whose souls the angels seize while they are in a state of purity, saying: "Peace be upon you. Enter Paradise as a reward for your deeds."
Text2: Thus, through a firm word, Allah grants firmness to the believers both in this world and in the Hereafter. As for the wrong-doers, Allah lets them go astray. Allah does whatever He wills.

Text1: And to those who had Judaized We have forbidden all beasts with claws, and the fat of oxen and sheep except the fat which is either on their backs or their entrails, or that which sticks to the bones. Thus did We requite them for their rebellion. Surely We state the Truth.
Text2: Thus, We forbade them many clean things which had earlier been made lawful for them, for the wrong-doing of those who became Jews, for their barring many from the way of Allah,

Text1: We have already recounted to you what We prohibited to the Jews. In so doing We did not wrong them; it is they who wronged themselves.
Text2: Thus, We forbade them many clean things which had earlier been made lawful for them, for the wrong-doing of those who became Jews, for their barring many from the way of Allah,

Text1: Spend your wealth for the cause of Allah, and be not cast by your own hands to ruin; and do good. Lo! Allah loveth the beneficent.
Text2: Thy Lord bringeth to pass what He willeth and chooseth. They have never any choice. Glorified be Allah and Exalted above all that they associate (with Him)!

Text1: Then he flung down his staff and it became a serpent manifest,
Text2: Thy Lord hath not forsaken thee nor doth He hate thee,

Text1: And let him share my task,
Text2: Thy Lord magnify,

Text1: That we may glorify Thee much
Text2: Thy raiment purify,

Text1: The Beneficent One, Who is established on the Throne.
Text2: Till (the day) when they shall behold that which they are promised (they may doubt); but then they will know (for certain) who is weaker in allies and less in multitude.

Text1: He said: Allah forbid that we should seize save him with whom we found our property; then truly we should be wrong-doers.
Text2: Till he was (distant) two bows_ length or even nearer,

Text1: Gardens of Eden underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide for ever. That is the reward of him who groweth.
Text2: Till the Inevitable came unto us.

Text1: And they observe toward a believer neither pact nor honour. These are they who are transgressors.
Text2: Till, when he cometh unto Us, he saith (unto his comrade): Ah, would that between me and thee there were the distance of the two horizons - an evil comrade!

Text1: And those who have no knowledge say: Why doth not Allah speak unto us, or some sign come unto us? Even thus, as they now speak, spake those (who were) before them. Their hearts are all alike. We have made clear the revelations for people who are sure.
Text2: Till, when they come (before their Lord), He will say: Did ye deny My revelations when ye could not compass them in knowledge, or what was it that ye did?

Text1: So when they took pride in that which they had been forbidden, We said unto them: Be ye apes despised and loathed!
Text2: Till, when they reach it, their ears and their eyes and their skins testify against them as to what they used to do.

Text1: Then, even after that, We pardoned you in order that ye might give thanks.
Text2: Till, when they reached the Valley of the Ants, an ant exclaimed: O ants! Enter your dwellings lest Solomon and his armies crush you, unperceiving.

Text1: (That is bound to happen in order that) He may make clear to them the reality regarding the matters on which they differ and that the unbelievers may realize that they were liars.
Text2: To Allah alone belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. He will requite the evil-doers for their deeds and bestow a goodly reward on those who have done good,

Text1: Allah has created the heavens and the earth in Truth. Certainly there is a Sign in this for those who believe.
Text2: To Allah alone belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. He will requite the evil-doers for their deeds and bestow a goodly reward on those who have done good,

Text1: He created the heavens and the earth with Truth. Exalted is He above whatever they associate with Allah in His Divinity.
Text2: To Allah alone belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. He will requite the evil-doers for their deeds and bestow a goodly reward on those who have done good,

Text1: so that Allah may requite each person for his deeds. Allah is swift in reckoning.
Text2: To Allah alone belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. He will requite the evil-doers for their deeds and bestow a goodly reward on those who have done good,

Text1: The kingdom of the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah alone, and all shall have to return to Him.
Text2: To Allah alone belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. He will requite the evil-doers for their deeds and bestow a goodly reward on those who have done good,

Text1: We did not create in sport the heavens and the earth and all that lies between the two.
Text2: To Allah alone belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. He will requite the evil-doers for their deeds and bestow a goodly reward on those who have done good,

Text1: We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that is in between them except with Truth. Surely the Hour will come. So, (O Muhammad), do graciously overlook them (despite their misdeeds).
Text2: To Allah alone belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. He will requite the evil-doers for their deeds and bestow a goodly reward on those who have done good,

Text1: for those who fear their Lord without seeing Him and dread the Hour (of Reckoning).
Text2: to everyone who feared the Merciful One though He is beyond the reach of perception, to everyone who has come with a heart ever wont to turn (to Him).

Text1: who believe in the unseen, establish the Salats and expend (in Our way) out of what We have bestowed on them;
Text2: to everyone who feared the Merciful One though He is beyond the reach of perception, to everyone who has come with a heart ever wont to turn (to Him).

Text1: They speak not until He hath spoken, and they act by His command.
Text2: To excuse or to warn,

Text1: from Pharaoh who was most prominent among the prodigals.
Text2: to Pharaoh and to his chiefs, but they behaved superciliously and they were haughty.

Text1: I shall withdraw from you and that unto which ye pray beside Allah, and I shall pray unto my Lord. It may be that, in prayer unto my Lord, I shall not be unblest.
Text2: To replace them by (others) better than them. And we are not to be outrun.

Text1: And messengers We have mentioned unto thee before and messengers We have not mentioned unto thee; and Allah spake directly unto Moses;
Text2: To warn whosoever liveth, and that the word may be fulfilled against the disbelievers.

Text1: We have appointed sacrificial camels among the symbols of (devotion to) Allah. There is much good in them for you. So make them stand (at the time of sacrifice) and pronounce the name of Allah over them, and when they fall down on their sides (after they are slaughtered), eat and also feed them who do not ask and those who ask. Thus have We subjected these animals that you may give thanks.
Text2: to witness the benefits in store for them, and pronounce the name of Allah during the appointed days over the cattle that He has provided them. So eat of it and feed the distressed and the needy.

Text1: They will ask their skins: _Why did you bear witness against us?ù The skins will reply: _Allah gave us speech, as He gave speech to all others. He it is Who created you for the first time and it is to Him that you will be sent back.
Text2: Today We shall put a seal on their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us and their feet shall bear witness to what they had been doing.

Text1: Say to them (O Muhammad!): 'Come, let me recite what your Lord has laid down to you: (i) that you associate nothing with Him; (ii) and do good to your parents; (iii) and do not slay your children out of fear of poverty. We provide you and will likewise provide them with sustenance; (iv) and do not even draw to things shameful - be they open or secret; (v) and do not slay the soul santified by Allah except in just cause; this He has enjoined upon you so that you may understand;
Text2: Truly it is only associating others with Allah in His divinity that Allah does not forgive, and forgives anything besides that to whomsoever He wills. Whoever associates others with Allah in His divinity has indeed strayed far away.

Text1: And guard yourselves against the Day when no one shall avail anyone anything; nor shall intercession be accepted from anyone; nor shall anyone be acquitted for any (amount of) ransom; nor shall the guilty ones be helped from any quarter.
Text2: Truly those who disbelieved and died as unbelievers, not even an earth full of gold will be accepted from them as ransom. For such people there is painful chastisement; and none shall come to their help.

Text1: Nay, but (the chosen of Allah is) he who fulfilleth his pledge and wardeth off (evil); for lo! Allah loveth those who ward off (evil).
Text2: Turn not thy cheek in scorn toward folk, nor walk with pertness in the land. Lo! Allah loveth not each braggart boaster.

Text1: Lo! they who deny Our revelations and scorn them, for them the gates of heaven will nor be opened not will they enter the Garden until the camel goeth through the needle_s eye. Thus do We requite the guilty.
Text2: Turn unto your Lord repentant, and surrender unto Him, before there come unto you the doom, when ye cannot be helped.

Text1: Say, (O Muhammad): Whether ye hide that which is in your breasts or reveal it, Allah knoweth it. He knoweth that which is in the heavens and that which is in the earth, and Allah is Able to do all things.
Text2: Turning unto Him (only); and be careful of your duty unto Him and establish worship, and be not of those who ascribe partners (unto Him);

Text1: Bear unto the hypocrites the tidings that for them there is a painful doom;
Text2: Unless by mercy from Us and as comfort for a while.

Text1: And on that Day We shall let some of them surge like waves against others, and the Trumpet shall be blown. Then We shall gather them all together.
Text2: until Gog and Magog are let loose, and begin swooping from every mound,

Text1: And of the camels twain and of the oxen twain. Say: Hath He forbidden the two males or the two females, or that which the wombs of the two females contain; or were ye by to witness when Allah commanded you (all) this? Then who doth greater wrong than he who deviseth a lie concerning Allah, that he may lead mankind astray without knowledge. Lo! Allah guideth not wrongdoing folk.
Text2: Until the day of the time appointed.

Text1: Likewise, Allah will neither forgive those who denied the truth and took to wrong-doing nor will He show them any other way.
Text2: until We seize with Our chastisement those of them that are given to luxuriant ways. They will then begin to groan.

Text1: Then afterward We drowned the others.
Text2: Until ye come to the graves.

Text1: When Allah showed them unto thee (O Muhammad) in thy dream as few in number, and if He had shown them to thee as many, ye (Muslims) would have faltered and would have quarrelled over the affair. But Allah saved (you). Lo! He knoweth what is in the breasts (of men).
Text2: Unto Allah belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. He createth what He will. He bestoweth female (offspring) upon whom He will, and bestoweth male (offspring) upon whom He will;

Text1: Say (O Muhammad): We believe in Allah and that which is revealed unto us and that which was revealed unto Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and the tribes, and that which was vouchsafed unto Moses and Jesus and the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and unto Him we have surrendered.
Text2: Unto Allah belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth. Lo! Allah, He is the Absolute, the Owner of Praise.

Text1: Those who say: Our Lord! Lo! we believe. So forgive us our sins and guard us from the punishment of Fire;
Text2: Unto Him be praise in the heavens and the earth! - and at the sun_s decline and in the noonday.

Text1: And when the Quran is recited, give ear to it and pay heed, that ye may obtain mercy.
Text2: Unto Him belongeth all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth, and He is the Sublime, the Tremendous.

Text1: That is because they say: The Fire will not touch us save for a certain number of days. That which they used to invent hath deceived them regarding their religion.
Text2: Unto Him belongeth whosoever is in the heavens and the earth. All are obedient unto Him.

Text1: And if ye call them to the Guidance, they follow you not. Whether ye call them or are silent is all one for you.
Text2: Unto Him is referred (all) knowledge of the Hour. And no fruits burst forth from their sheaths, and no female carrieth or bringeth forth but with His knowledge. And on the day when He calleth unto them: Where are now My partners? they will say: We confess unto Thee, not one of us is a witness (for them).

Text1: He said: Nay, do ye throw! Then lo! their cords and their staves, by their magic, appeared to him as though they ran.
Text2: Unto him of you who will advance or hang back.

Text1: While those who strive to thwart Our revelations, such are rightful owners of the Fire.
Text2: Unto him thou payest regard.

Text1: And unto Midian (We sent) their brother, Shu_eyb. He said: O my people! Serve Allah. Ye have no other Allah save Him. Lo! a clear proof hath come unto you from your Lord; so give full measure and full weight and wrong not mankind in their goods, and work not confusion in the earth after the fair ordering thereof. That will be better for you, if ye are believers.
Text2: Unto Pharaoh and Haman and Korah, but they said: A lying sorcerer!

Text1: When ye sought help of your Lord and He answered you (saying): I will help you with a thousand of the angels, rank on rank.
Text2: Unto this, then, summon (O Muhammad). And be thou upright as thou art commanded, and follow not their lusts, but say: I believe in whatever scripture Allah hath sent down, and I am commanded to be just among you. Allah is our Lord and your Lord. Unto us our works and unto you your works; no argument between us and you. Allah will bring us together, and unto Him is the journeying.

Text1: And the folk of Abraham and the folk of Lot;
Text2: Unto thy Lord belongeth (knowledge of) the term thereof.

Text1: (Moses) said: Then go! and lo! in this life it is for thee to say: Touch me not! and lo! there is for thee a tryst thou canst not break. Now look upon thy god of which thou hast remained a votary. Verily we will burn it and will scatter its dust over the sea.
Text2: Unto thy Lord is the recourse that day.

Text1: And verily We made a covenant of old with Adam, but he forgot, and We found no constancy in him.
Text2: Unto thy Lord that day will be the driving.

Text1: There is naught but our life of the world; we die and we live, and we shall not be raised (again).
Text2: Unto whomsoever of you willeth to walk straight.

Text1: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me.
Text2: Unto you your religion, and unto me my religion.

Text1: He said: So (it will be). Thy Lord saith: It is easy for Me, even as I created thee before, when thou wast naught.
Text2: Upon the disbelievers, which none can repel,

Text1: And who are shepherds of their pledge and their covenant,
Text2: Veiled in darkness,

Text1: Those who forswear their wives must wait four months; then, if they change their mind, lo! Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
Text2: Verily Allah knoweth those who believe, and verily He knoweth the hypocrites.

Text1: And when they came (again) before him (Joseph) they said: O ruler! Misfortune hath touched us and our folk, and we bring but poor merchandise, so fill for us the measure and be charitable unto us. Lo! Allah will requite the charitable,
Text2: Verily he saw one of the greater revelations of his Lord.

Text1: who realize that ultimately they shall meet their Lord and shall return to Him.
Text2: Verily I was sure that I would be handed over my account.ù

Text1: And verily ye used to wish for death before ye met it (in the field). Now ye have seen it with your eyes!
Text2: Verily in the messenger of Allah ye have a good example for him who looketh unto Allah and the Last Day, and remembereth Allah much.

Text1: We have bestowed upon you a Book that mentions you. Do you not understand?
Text2: Verily it is a great source of eminence for you and your people, and soon you will be called to account concerning that.

Text1: that this is the speech of an honourable Messenger,
Text2: Verily this is the word of a noble message-bearer;

Text1: And did We not show him the two highroads (of good and evil)?
Text2: Verily We created man out of a drop of intermingled sperm so that We might try him, and We therefore endowed him with hearing and sight.

Text1: Does man not see that We created him of a sperm drop, and lo! he is flagrantly contentious?
Text2: Verily We created man out of a drop of intermingled sperm so that We might try him, and We therefore endowed him with hearing and sight.

Text1: As for those who disbelieve I shall chastise them with a heavy chastisement in the world and the Hereafter; and they will have no helpers.
Text2: Verily We have coined for mankind in this Quran all kinds of similitudes; and indeed if thou camest unto them with a miracle, those who disbelieve would verily exclaim: Ye are but tricksters!

Text1: (And remember) when the angels said: O Mary! Lo! Allah giveth thee glad tidings of a word from him, whose name is the Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary, illustrious in the world and the Hereafter, and one of those brought near (unto Allah).
Text2: Verily We sent before thee (Muhammad) messengers to their own folk. Then we took vengeance upon those who were guilty (in regard to them). To help believers is ever incumbent upon Us.

Text1: Lo! as for these, their way will be destroyed and all that they are doing is in vain.
Text2: Verily We sent messengers before thee, among them those of whom We have told thee, and some of whom We have not told thee; and it was not given to any messenger that he should bring a portent save by Allah_s leave, but when Allah_s commandment cometh (the cause) is judged aright, and the followers of vanity will then be lost.

Text1: Then We rescued Noah together with the people in the Ark and made it (that is, the Ark) a lesson for all people.
Text2: Verily when the water rose to great heights, We bore you upon a floating vessel (i.e. the Ark)

Text1: Lo! this Quran guideth unto that which is straightest, and giveth tidings unto the believers who do good works that theirs will be a great reward.
Text2: Verily ye have in them a goodly pattern for everyone who looketh to Allah and the Last Day. And whosoever may turn away, lo! still Allah, He is the Absolute, the Owner of Praise.

Text1: So bear patiently with what they say. Glorify your Lord, praising Him before sunrise and before sunset, and in the watches of the night, and glorify Him and at the ends of the day that you may attain to happiness.
Text2: Verily your Lord will soon give you so amply that you will be well-pleased.

Text1: It is not for the townsfolk of Al-Madinah and for those around them of the wandering Arabs so stay behind the messenger of Allah and prefer their lives to his life. That is because neither thirst nor toil nor hunger afflicteth them in the way of Allah, nor step they any step that angereth the disbelievers, nor gain they from the enemy a gain, but a good deed is recorded for them therefor. Lo! Allah loseth not the wages of the good.
Text2: Wait then (O Muhammad). Lo! they (too) are waiting.

Text1: And (Salih) turned from them and said: O my people! I delivered my Lord_s message unto you and gave you good advice, but ye love not good advisers.
Text2: Warn them (O Muhammad) of the Day of the approaching (doom), when the hearts will be choking the throats, (when) there will be no friend for the wrong-doers, nor any intercessor who will be heard.

Text1: from a drop of sperm when it was emitted,
Text2: Was he not a drop of ejaculated semen,

Text1: Then his Lord chose him, and relented toward him, and guided him.
Text2: Was he not a drop of fluid which gushed forth?

Text1: Those whom the angels cause to die (when they are) good. They say: Peace be unto you! Enter the Garden because of what ye used to do.
Text2: Was it ye who made the tree thereof to grow, or were We the grower?

Text1: He answered: "So shall it be." Your Lord says: "It is easy for Me," and then added: "For beyond doubt, I created you earlier when you were nothing."
Text2: Was there a period of time when man was not even worthy of a mention?

Text1: How is it that you adopt the attitude of disbelief towards Allah when the fact is that you were lifeless and He gave you life, and He will take away life from you and will again restore you to life: then you shall ultimately return to Him.
Text2: Was there a period of time when man was not even worthy of a mention?

Text1: you are no different from a mortal like us. So produce a sign if you are truthful."
Text2: Was there none but he to whom the Reminder could be vouchsafed excluding all others? Nay; he is an insolent liar.ù

Text1: And remember that Abraham prayed, "Lord, make this city a city of peace and security, and provide with every kind of fruit those of its people, who believe in Allah and the Last Day'. Allah answered, "As for the disbelievers, I will also provide them with the necessities of life in this world, though in the Next World I will drag them to the torment of Hell, and that is the worst abode."
Text2: We allow them to enjoy themselves a while in the world and then We shall drive them in utter helplessness to a harsh chastisement.

Text1: Eat and enjoy yourselves for a while. Surely you are evil-doers.
Text2: We allow them to enjoy themselves a while in the world and then We shall drive them in utter helplessness to a harsh chastisement.

Text1: None but the unbelievers dispute regarding the Signs of Allah. So let not their strutting about in the land delude you.
Text2: We allow them to enjoy themselves a while in the world and then We shall drive them in utter helplessness to a harsh chastisement.

Text1: So leave the unbelievers to themselves; respite them awhile.
Text2: We allow them to enjoy themselves a while in the world and then We shall drive them in utter helplessness to a harsh chastisement.

Text1: Therefore, do not hasten (in seeking a scourge against them). We are counting their days.
Text2: We allow them to enjoy themselves a while in the world and then We shall drive them in utter helplessness to a harsh chastisement.

Text1: They have set up rivals to Allah that they may lead people astray from His way. Tell them: "Enjoy for a while. You are doomed to end up in the Fire!"
Text2: We allow them to enjoy themselves a while in the world and then We shall drive them in utter helplessness to a harsh chastisement.

Text1: This is but a little enjoyment, then their destination is Hell -what an evil resting place!
Text2: We allow them to enjoy themselves a while in the world and then We shall drive them in utter helplessness to a harsh chastisement.

Text1: When any affliction befalls man, he cries out to his Lord, penitently turning to Him. But when his Lord bestows His favour upon him, he forgets the affliction regarding which he had cried out and sets up compeers to Allah that they may lead others astray from His Path. Say, (O Prophet): _Enjoy your unbelief for a while. Surely you will be among the inmates of the Fire.ù
Text2: We allow them to enjoy themselves a while in the world and then We shall drive them in utter helplessness to a harsh chastisement.

Text1: And unto Midian (We sent) their brother Shu_eyb. He said: O my people! Serve Allah. Ye have no other Allah save Him! And give not short measure and short weight. Lo! I see you well-to-do, and lo! I fear for you the doom of a besetting Day.
Text2: We are Best Aware of what they say, and thou (O Muhammad) art in no wise a compeller over them. But warn by the Quran him who feareth My threat.

Text1: Do not let the, unbelievers imagine that the respite We give them is good for them. We give them respite so that they may grow in wickedness. A humiliating chastisement lies in store for them.
Text2: We are busy lavishing on them all kinds of good? Nay, they do not perceive the reality of the matter.

Text1: Let neither their riches nor their children excite your admiration. Allah only wants to chastise them through these things in the present life, and to cause them to die while they are unbelievers.
Text2: We are busy lavishing on them all kinds of good? Nay, they do not perceive the reality of the matter.

Text1: (Little do they realize that) Allah is mocking at them. He gives them rope enough, and they wander on and on blindly in their mischief and rebellion.
Text2: We are turning their hearts and eyes away from the Truth even as they did not believe in the first instance - and We leave them in their insurgence to stumble blindly.

Text1: Allah has sealed up their hearts and ears and a covering has fallen over their eyes, and they have incurred the severest punishment.
Text2: We are turning their hearts and eyes away from the Truth even as they did not believe in the first instance - and We leave them in their insurgence to stumble blindly.

Text1: As for him who sets himself against the Messenger and follows a path other than that of the believers even after true guidance had become clear to him, We will let him go to the way he has turned to, and We will cast him into Hell - an evil destination.
Text2: We are turning their hearts and eyes away from the Truth even as they did not believe in the first instance - and We leave them in their insurgence to stumble blindly.

Text1: As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made their deeds seem attractive to them so they stumble around in perplexity.
Text2: We are turning their hearts and eyes away from the Truth even as they did not believe in the first instance - and We leave them in their insurgence to stumble blindly.

Text1: I shall turn away from My signs those who, without any right, behaved haughtily in the earth, even if they may, witness each and every, sign, they shall not believe therein. And even if they see the right path, they shall still not follow it; but if they see the path of error. they shall choose it for their path. This is because they rejected Our signs as false and were heedless to them.
Text2: We are turning their hearts and eyes away from the Truth even as they did not believe in the first instance - and We leave them in their insurgence to stumble blindly.

Text1: Indeed some people before you had asked such questions and in consequence fell into unbelief.
Text2: We are turning their hearts and eyes away from the Truth even as they did not believe in the first instance - and We leave them in their insurgence to stumble blindly.

Text1: For them are glad tidings in this world and in the Hereafter. The words of Allah shall not change. That is the supreme triumph.
Text2: We are your companions in this world and in the Hereafter. There you shall have all that you desire and all what you will ask for.

Text1: those whose souls the angels seize while they are in a state of purity, saying: "Peace be upon you. Enter Paradise as a reward for your deeds."
Text2: We are your companions in this world and in the Hereafter. There you shall have all that you desire and all what you will ask for.

Text1: Evil as an example are the folk who denied Our revelations, and were wont to wrong themselves.
Text2: We are your protecting friends in the life of the world and in the Hereafter. There ye will have (all) that your souls desire, and there ye will have (all) for which ye pray.

Text1: Say: I am only a mortal like you. My Lord inspireth in me that your Allah is only One Allah. And whoever hopeth for the meeting with his Lord, let him do righteous work, and make none sharer of the worship due unto his Lord.
Text2: We assuredly had taken him by the right hand

Text1: Will you punish us just because we believed in the signs of our Lord when they came to us? Our Lord! Shower us with perseverance and cause us to die as those who have submitted [to You].'
Text2: We believe in our Lord that He may forgive us our sins and also forgive us the practice of magic to which you had compelled us. Allah is the Best and He alone will abide."

Text1: And remember Our servant Job: when he cried to his Lord: _Behold, Satan has afflicted me with much hardship and suffering.ù
Text2: We bestowed (the same wisdom, judgement and knowledge) upon Job. Recall, when he cried to his Lord: "Behold, disease has struck me and You are the Most Merciful of those that are merciful."

Text1: and grant me an honourable reputation among posterity,
Text2: We bestowed good upon him in this world, and in the Hereafter he shall certainly be among the righteous.

Text1: and We bestowed upon him (offspring like) Isaac and Jacob, and bestowed prophethood and the Book on his descendants and granted him his reward in this world; he will certainly be among the righteous in the Hereafter.
Text2: We bestowed good upon him in this world, and in the Hereafter he shall certainly be among the righteous.

Text1: It was We Who taught him the art of making coats of mail for your benefit so that it may protect you from each other's violence. Do you, then, give thanks?
Text2: We bestowed Our favour upon David. (We commanded): _O mountains, sing Allah's praises with himù; (and so did We command) the birds. We softened the iron for him, (saying):

Text1: With him We had subjected the mountains that they join him in celebrating Allah's glory, evening and morning,
Text2: We bestowed Our favour upon David. (We commanded): _O mountains, sing Allah's praises with himù; (and so did We command) the birds. We softened the iron for him, (saying):

Text1: Allah effaces whatever He wills and retains whatever He wills. With Him is the Mother of the Book.
Text2: We bring a better verse or at least the like of it for whatever we abrogate or cause it to be forgotten.

Text1: Whenever We replace one verse by another verse - and Allah knows what He should reveal - they are wont to say: "You are nothing but a fabricator (who has invented the Quran)." The fact is that most of them are ignorant of the Truth.
Text2: We bring a better verse or at least the like of it for whatever we abrogate or cause it to be forgotten.

Text1: O ye who believe! Ye have charge of your own souls. He who erreth cannot injure you if ye are rightly guided. Unto Allah ye will all return; and then He will inform you of what ye used to do.
Text2: We called unto him: O Abraham!

Text1: (O Messenger!) Let it not happen that you omit (to expound) a portion of what was revealed to you. And do not be distressed that they will say: 'Why was a treasure not bestowed upon him?' or 'Why did no angel accompany him?' For you are merely a warner, whereas Allah has control over everything.
Text2: We certainly know that their statements sorely grieve you.

Text1: We initiated your creation, then We gave you each a shape, and then We said to the angels: 'Prostrate before Adam.') They all prostrated except Iblis: he was not one of those who fell Prostrate.
Text2: We created man out of the extract of clay,

Text1: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Who provideth for you from the sky and the earth, or Who owneth hearing and sight; and Who bringeth forth the living from the dead and bringeth forth the dead from the living; and Who directeth the course? They will say: Allah. Then say: Will ye not then keep your duty (unto Him)?
Text2: We created not the heavens and the earth and all that is between them save with truth, and for a term appointed. But those who disbelieve turn away from that whereof they are warned.

Text1: Then He made them seven heavens in two days and revealed to each heaven its law. And We adorned the lower heaven with lamps, and firmly secured it. All this is the firm plan of the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing.
Text2: We created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six days, and weariness did not even touch Us.

Text1: And the first to lead the way, of the Muhajirin and the Ansar, and those who followed them in goodness - Allah is well pleased with them and they are well pleased with Him, and He hath made ready for them Gardens underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide for ever. That is the supreme triumph.
Text2: We created them not save with truth; but most of them know not.

Text1: Is He then Who createth as him who createth not? Will ye not then remember?
Text2: We created you. Will ye then admit the truth?

Text1: And He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in six days - and [before that] His Throne was upon the water that He may test you, who of you is better in conduct If you were to say (O Muhammad): 'All of you will surely be raised after death', then those who disbelieve will certainly say: 'This is nothing but plain sorcery.
Text2: We did not create this heaven and earth and all that lies between them in vain. That is the fancy of those who denied the Truth. So woe from the Fire to all who deny the Truth.

Text1: It was not in idle sport that We created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them.
Text2: We did not create this heaven and earth and all that lies between them in vain. That is the fancy of those who denied the Truth. So woe from the Fire to all who deny the Truth.

Text1: We did not create in sport the heavens and the earth and all that lies between the two.
Text2: We did not create this heaven and earth and all that lies between them in vain. That is the fancy of those who denied the Truth. So woe from the Fire to all who deny the Truth.

Text1: We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that is in between them except with Truth. Surely the Hour will come. So, (O Muhammad), do graciously overlook them (despite their misdeeds).
Text2: We did not create this heaven and earth and all that lies between them in vain. That is the fancy of those who denied the Truth. So woe from the Fire to all who deny the Truth.

Text1: (O Muhammad), whenever We raised any Messengers before you, they were no other than human beings; (except that) to them We sent revelation. So ask those who possess knowledge if you do not know.
Text2: We did not endow the Messengers with bodies that would need no food; nor were they immortals.

Text1: O Muhammad,, all the Messengers whom We sent before you also ate food and moved about in the streets. In fact, We have made you all a means of test for one another. Will you show patience? for your Lord sees everything.
Text2: We did not endow the Messengers with bodies that would need no food; nor were they immortals.

Text1: And your Lord is not such as would wrongfully destroy human habitations while their inhabitants are righteous.
Text2: We did not wrong them; it is rather they who wronged themselves. And when the command of your Lord came to pass, the gods besides Allah whom they had called upon, did not avail them in the least. They added nothing to them except ruin.

Text1: They also say: 'Why has no angel been sent down to this Prophet?' Had We sent down an angel, the matter would surely have long been decided and no respite would have been granted them.
Text2: We do not send down the angels (in frivolity); and when We do send them down, We do so with Truth; then people are granted no respite.

Text1: We truly tell you that we have brought to you the Truth.
Text2: We do not send down the angels (in frivolity); and when We do send them down, We do so with Truth; then people are granted no respite.

Text1: and has made me dutiful to my mother. He has not made me oppressive, nor bereft of God's blessings.
Text2: We enjoined upon man to be dutiful to his parents. His mother bore him in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning lasted two years. (We, therefore, enjoined upon him): _Give thanks to Me and to your parents. To Me is your ultimate return.

Text1: Remember that We made a solemn covenant with the children of Israel to this effect: worship none save Allah: be good to your parents, to your relatives, to the orphans and to the helpless; speak aright with the people: establish the Salat and pay the Zakat. But with the exception of a few, you all slid back from it and are paying no heed to it even now.
Text2: We enjoined upon man to be dutiful to his parents. His mother bore him in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning lasted two years. (We, therefore, enjoined upon him): _Give thanks to Me and to your parents. To Me is your ultimate return.

Text1: Say to them (O Muhammad!): 'Come, let me recite what your Lord has laid down to you: (i) that you associate nothing with Him; (ii) and do good to your parents; (iii) and do not slay your children out of fear of poverty. We provide you and will likewise provide them with sustenance; (iv) and do not even draw to things shameful - be they open or secret; (v) and do not slay the soul santified by Allah except in just cause; this He has enjoined upon you so that you may understand;
Text2: We enjoined upon man to be dutiful to his parents. His mother bore him in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning lasted two years. (We, therefore, enjoined upon him): _Give thanks to Me and to your parents. To Me is your ultimate return.

Text1: Serve Allah and ascribe no partner to Him. Do good to your parents, to near of kin, to orphans, and to the needy, and to the neighbour who is of kin and to the neighbour who is a stranger, and to the companion by your side, and to the wayfarer, and to those whom your right hands possess. Allah does not love the arrogant and the boastful,
Text2: We enjoined upon man to be dutiful to his parents. His mother bore him in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning lasted two years. (We, therefore, enjoined upon him): _Give thanks to Me and to your parents. To Me is your ultimate return.

Text1: The (divorced) mothers shall suckle their children for two whole years, if the fathers desire the suckling to be completed. In that case the father of the child shall, in the fair known way, be responsible for their food and clothing. But none should be burdened with more than one can bear: neither the mother should be pressed unjustly (to accept unfair terms) just because she is the mother nor should the father be burdened just because he is the father. And the same responsibility for the maintenance of the mother devolves upon the father of the child and his heir. There is no harm if they wean the child by mutual consent and consultation. Moreover, there is no harm if you choose to give your children a suckle by a wet nurse, provided that you pay her fairly. Fear Allah and know it well that whatever you do is in the sight of Allah.
Text2: We enjoined upon man to be dutiful to his parents. His mother bore him in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning lasted two years. (We, therefore, enjoined upon him): _Give thanks to Me and to your parents. To Me is your ultimate return.

Text1: We have enjoined man to be kind to his parents. In pain did his mother bear him and in pain did she give birth to him. The carrying of the child to his weaning is a period of thirty months. And when he is grown to full maturity and reaches the age of forty, he prays: _My Lord, dispose me that I may give thanks for the bounty that You have bestowed upon me and my parents, and dispose me that I may do righteous deeds that would please You, and also make my descendants righteous. I repent to You, and I am one of those who surrender themselves to You.ù
Text2: We enjoined upon man to be dutiful to his parents. His mother bore him in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning lasted two years. (We, therefore, enjoined upon him): _Give thanks to Me and to your parents. To Me is your ultimate return.

Text1: Your Lord has decreed: (i) Do not worship any but Him; (ii) Be good to your parents; and should both or any one of them attain old age with you, do not say to them even "fie" neither chide them, but speak to them with respect,
Text2: We enjoined upon man to be dutiful to his parents. His mother bore him in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning lasted two years. (We, therefore, enjoined upon him): _Give thanks to Me and to your parents. To Me is your ultimate return.

Text1: Verily We bestowed the Book upon Moses. So entertain no doubt if (the Prophet Muhammad) received the same. We had made that Book a guidance for the Children of Israel,
Text2: We gave Moses the Book, and made it a source of guidance for the Children of Israel, commanding: "Take no other Guardian beside Me."

Text1: Then whosoever after this shall turn away: they will be miscreants.
Text2: We give them comfort for a little, and then We drive them to a heavy doom.

Text1: Now put your hand into your bosom, and it will come forth shining without any blemish. (These are two of the) nine Signs to be carried to Pharaoh and his people. They are surely a wicked people."
Text2: We granted Moses nine clear signs. Ask the Children of Israel about that: when these signs came forth, Pharaoh said to him: "Moses, I think that you are bewitched."

Text1: He who is negligent to remember the Merciful One, to him We assign a satan as his boon companion,
Text2: We had assigned to them companions who embellished for them all that was before them and behind them. Thus the same decree (of chastisement) which had overtaken the previous generations of jinn and human beings (also) became due against them. Surely they became the losers.

Text1: And certainly We have created for Hell many of the jinn and mankind; they have hearts with which they fail to understand; and they have eyes with which they fail to see; and they have ears with which they fail to hear. They are like cattle - indeed, even more astray. Such are utterly heedless.
Text2: We had established them firmly in a manner We have not established you. We had given them ears and eyes and hearts. But nothing availed them -- neither their ears, nor their eyes, nor their hearts, for they denied the Signs of Allah. Then what they had mocked at encompassed them.

Text1: Then Allah sent a raven scratching up the ground, to show him how to hide his brother_s naked corpse. He said: Woe unto me! Am I not able to be as this raven and so hide my brother_s naked corpse? And he became repentant.
Text2: We had no power over you, but ye were wayward folk.

Text1: and are repelled. Theirs is an unceasing chastisement.
Text2: We have adorned the lower heaven with lamps, and have made them a means to drive away the satans. We have prepared for them the chastisement of the Blazing Fire.

Text1: Highly blessed is He, Who has made fortified spheres in the heavens and has set in it a "lamp" and a shining moon.
Text2: We have adorned the lower heaven with lamps, and have made them a means to drive away the satans. We have prepared for them the chastisement of the Blazing Fire.

Text1: We have adorned the lower heaven with the adornment of the stars
Text2: We have adorned the lower heaven with lamps, and have made them a means to drive away the satans. We have prepared for them the chastisement of the Blazing Fire.

Text1: We have adorned the lower heaven with lamps, and have made them a means to drive away the satans. We have prepared for them the chastisement of the Blazing Fire.
Text2: We have adorned the lower heaven with the adornment of the stars

Text1: Then Pharaoh went and gathered his strength, then came (to the appointed tryst).
Text2: We have appointed only angels to be wardens of the Fire, and their number have We made to be a stumbling-block for those who disbelieve; that those to whom the Scripture hath been given may have certainty, and that believers may increase in faith; and that those to whom the Scripture hath been given and believers may not doubt; and that those in whose hearts there is disease, and disbelievers, may say: What meaneth Allah by this similitude? Thus Allah sendeth astray whom He will, and whom He will He guideth. None knoweth the hosts of thy Lord save Him. This is naught else than a Reminder unto mortals.

Text1: to witness the benefits in store for them, and pronounce the name of Allah during the appointed days over the cattle that He has provided them. So eat of it and feed the distressed and the needy.
Text2: We have appointed sacrificial camels among the symbols of (devotion to) Allah. There is much good in them for you. So make them stand (at the time of sacrifice) and pronounce the name of Allah over them, and when they fall down on their sides (after they are slaughtered), eat and also feed them who do not ask and those who ask. Thus have We subjected these animals that you may give thanks.

Text1: He it is Who gave the sun radiance and the moon light, and determined the stages (for the waxing and waning of the moon) that you may learn the calculation of years and the reckoning of time. Allah has created all this with a rightful purpose (rather than out of play). He expounds His signs for the people who know.
Text2: We have appointed stages for the moon till it returns in the shape of a dry old branch of palm-tree.

Text1: Surely your Lord is none other than Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth in six days, and then ascended His Throne; Who causes the night to cover the day and then the day swiftly pursues the night; Who created the sun and the moon and the stars making them all subservient to His command. Lo! His is the creation and His is the command. Blessed is Allah, the Lord of the universe.
Text2: We have appointed stages for the moon till it returns in the shape of a dry old branch of palm-tree.

Text1: Sad, and by the Quran full of exhortation!
Text2: We have bestowed upon you a Book that mentions you. Do you not understand?

Text1: Verily it is a great source of eminence for you and your people, and soon you will be called to account concerning that.
Text2: We have bestowed upon you a Book that mentions you. Do you not understand?

Text1: When they said: Verily Joseph and his brother are dearer to our father than we are, many though we be. Lo! our father is in plain aberration.
